00004 
00005 """Xcode project file generator.
00006 
00007 This module is both an Xcode project file generator and a documentation of the
00008 Xcode project file format.  Knowledge of the project file format was gained
00009 based on extensive experience with Xcode, and by making changes to projects in
00010 Xcode.app and observing the resultant changes in the associated project files.
00011 
00012 XCODE PROJECT FILES
00013 
00014 The generator targets the file format as written by Xcode 3.2 (specifically,
00015 3.2.6), but past experience has taught that the format has not changed
00016 significantly in the past several years, and future versions of Xcode are able
00017 to read older project files.
00018 
00019 Xcode project files are "bundled": the project "file" from an end-user's
00020 perspective is actually a directory with an ".xcodeproj" extension.  The
00021 project file from this module's perspective is actually a file inside this
00022 directory, always named "project.pbxproj".  This file contains a complete
00023 description of the project and is all that is needed to use the xcodeproj.
00024 Other files contained in the xcodeproj directory are simply used to store
00025 per-user settings, such as the state of various UI elements in the Xcode
00026 application.
00027 
00028 The project.pbxproj file is a property list, stored in a format almost
00029 identical to the NeXTstep property list format.  The file is able to carry
00030 Unicode data, and is encoded in UTF-8.  The root element in the property list
00031 is a dictionary that contains several properties of minimal interest, and two
00032 properties of immense interest.  The most important property is a dictionary
00033 named "objects".  The entire structure of the project is represented by the
00034 children of this property.  The objects dictionary is keyed by unique 96-bit
00035 values represented by 24 uppercase hexadecimal characters.  Each value in the
00036 objects dictionary is itself a dictionary, describing an individual object.
00037 
00038 Each object in the dictionary is a member of a class, which is identified by
00039 the "isa" property of each object.  A variety of classes are represented in a
00040 project file.  Objects can refer to other objects by ID, using the 24-character
00041 hexadecimal object key.  A project's objects form a tree, with a root object
00042 of class PBXProject at the root.  As an example, the PBXProject object serves
00043 as parent to an XCConfigurationList object defining the build configurations
00044 used in the project, a PBXGroup object serving as a container for all files
00045 referenced in the project, and a list of target objects, each of which defines
00046 a target in the project.  There are several different types of target object,
00047 such as PBXNativeTarget and PBXAggregateTarget.  In this module, this
00048 relationship is expressed by having each target type derive from an abstract
00049 base named XCTarget.
00050 
00051 The project.pbxproj file's root dictionary also contains a property, sibling to
00052 the "objects" dictionary, named "rootObject".  The value of rootObject is a
00053 24-character object key referring to the root PBXProject object in the
00054 objects dictionary.
00055 
00056 In Xcode, every file used as input to a target or produced as a final product
00057 of a target must appear somewhere in the hierarchy rooted at the PBXGroup
00058 object referenced by the PBXProject's mainGroup property.  A PBXGroup is
00059 generally represented as a folder in the Xcode application.  PBXGroups can
00060 contain other PBXGroups as well as PBXFileReferences, which are pointers to
00061 actual files.
00062 
00063 Each XCTarget contains a list of build phases, represented in this module by
00064 the abstract base XCBuildPhase.  Examples of concrete XCBuildPhase derivations
00065 are PBXSourcesBuildPhase and PBXFrameworksBuildPhase, which correspond to the
00066 "Compile Sources" and "Link Binary With Libraries" phases displayed in the
00067 Xcode application.  Files used as input to these phases (for example, source
00068 files in the former case and libraries and frameworks in the latter) are
00069 represented by PBXBuildFile objects, referenced by elements of "files" lists
00070 in XCTarget objects.  Each PBXBuildFile object refers to a PBXBuildFile
00071 object as a "weak" reference: it does not "own" the PBXBuildFile, which is
00072 owned by the root object's mainGroup or a descendant group.  In most cases, the
00073 layer of indirection between an XCBuildPhase and a PBXFileReference via a
00074 PBXBuildFile appears extraneous, but there's actually one reason for this:
00075 file-specific compiler flags are added to the PBXBuildFile object so as to
00076 allow a single file to be a member of multiple targets while having distinct
00077 compiler flags for each.  These flags can be modified in the Xcode applciation
00078 in the "Build" tab of a File Info window.
00079 
00080 When a project is open in the Xcode application, Xcode will rewrite it.  As
00081 such, this module is careful to adhere to the formatting used by Xcode, to
00082 avoid insignificant changes appearing in the file when it is used in the
00083 Xcode application.  This will keep version control repositories happy, and
00084 makes it possible to compare a project file used in Xcode to one generated by
00085 this module to determine if any significant changes were made in the
00086 application.
00087 
00088 Xcode has its own way of assigning 24-character identifiers to each object,
00089 which is not duplicated here.  Because the identifier only is only generated
00090 once, when an object is created, and is then left unchanged, there is no need
00091 to attempt to duplicate Xcode's behavior in this area.  The generator is free
00092 to select any identifier, even at random, to refer to the objects it creates,
00093 and Xcode will retain those identifiers and use them when subsequently
00094 rewriting the project file.  However, the generator would choose new random
00095 identifiers each time the project files are generated, leading to difficulties
00096 comparing "used" project files to "pristine" ones produced by this module,
00097 and causing the appearance of changes as every object identifier is changed
00098 when updated projects are checked in to a version control repository.  To
00099 mitigate this problem, this module chooses identifiers in a more deterministic
00100 way, by hashing a description of each object as well as its parent and ancestor
00101 objects.  This strategy should result in minimal "shift" in IDs as successive
00102 generations of project files are produced.
00103 
00104 THIS MODULE
00105 
00106 This module introduces several classes, all derived from the XCObject class.
00107 Nearly all of the "brains" are built into the XCObject class, which understands
00108 how to create and modify objects, maintain the proper tree structure, compute
00109 identifiers, and print objects.  For the most part, classes derived from
00110 XCObject need only provide a _schema class object, a dictionary that
00111 expresses what properties objects of the class may contain.
00112 
00113 Given this structure, it's possible to build a minimal project file by creating
00114 objects of the appropriate types and making the proper connections:
00115 
00116   config_list = XCConfigurationList()
00117   group = PBXGroup()
00118   project = PBXProject({'buildConfigurationList': config_list,
00119                         'mainGroup': group})
00120 
00121 With the project object set up, it can be added to an XCProjectFile object.
00122 XCProjectFile is a pseudo-class in the sense that it is a concrete XCObject
00123 subclass that does not actually correspond to a class type found in a project
00124 file.  Rather, it is used to represent the project file's root dictionary.
00125 Printing an XCProjectFile will print the entire project file, including the
00126 full "objects" dictionary.
00127 
00128   project_file = XCProjectFile({'rootObject': project})
00129   project_file.ComputeIDs()
00130   project_file.Print()
00131 
00132 Xcode project files are always encoded in UTF-8.  This module will accept
00133 strings of either the str class or the unicode class.  Strings of class str
00134 are assumed to already be encoded in UTF-8.  Obviously, if you're just using
00135 ASCII, you won't encounter difficulties because ASCII is a UTF-8 subset.
00136 Strings of class unicode are handled properly and encoded in UTF-8 when
00137 a project file is output.
00138 """
00139 
00140 import gyp.common
00141 import posixpath
00142 import re
00143 import struct
00144 import sys
00145 
00146 # hashlib is supplied as of Python 2.5 as the replacement interface for sha
00147 # and other secure hashes.  In 2.6, sha is deprecated.  Import hashlib if
00148 # available, avoiding a deprecation warning under 2.6.  Import sha otherwise,
00149 # preserving 2.4 compatibility.
00150 try:
00151   import hashlib
00152   _new_sha1 = hashlib.sha1
00153 except ImportError:
00154   import sha
00155   _new_sha1 = sha.new
00156 
00157 
00158 # See XCObject._EncodeString.  This pattern is used to determine when a string
00159 # can be printed unquoted.  Strings that match this pattern may be printed
00160 # unquoted.  Strings that do not match must be quoted and may be further
00161 # transformed to be properly encoded.  Note that this expression matches the
00162 # characters listed with "+", for 1 or more occurrences: if a string is empty,
00163 # it must not match this pattern, because it needs to be encoded as "".
00164 _unquoted = re.compile('^[A-Za-z0-9$./_]+$')
00165 
00166 # Strings that match this pattern are quoted regardless of what _unquoted says.
00167 # Oddly, Xcode will quote any string with a run of three or more underscores.
00168 _quoted = re.compile('___')
00169 
00170 # This pattern should match any character that needs to be escaped by
00171 # XCObject._EncodeString.  See that function.
00172 _escaped = re.compile('[\\\\"]|[\x00-\x1f]')
00173 
00174 
00175 # Used by SourceTreeAndPathFromPath
00176 _path_leading_variable = re.compile(r'^\$\((.*?)\)(/(.*))?$')
00177 
00178 def SourceTreeAndPathFromPath(input_path):
00179   """Given input_path, returns a tuple with sourceTree and path values.
00180 
00181   Examples:
00182     input_path     (source_tree, output_path)
00183     '$(VAR)/path'  ('VAR', 'path')
00184     '$(VAR)'       ('VAR', None)
00185     'path'         (None, 'path')
00186   """
00187 
00188   source_group_match = _path_leading_variable.match(input_path)
00189   if source_group_match:
00190     source_tree = source_group_match.group(1)
00191     output_path = source_group_match.group(3)  # This may be None.
00192   else:
00193     source_tree = None
00194     output_path = input_path
00195 
00196   return (source_tree, output_path)
00197 
00198 def ConvertVariablesToShellSyntax(input_string):
00199   return re.sub(r'\$\((.*?)\)', '${\\1}', input_string)
00200 
00201 class XCObject(object):
00202   """The abstract base of all class types used in Xcode project files.
00203 
00204   Class variables:
00205     _schema: A dictionary defining the properties of this class.  The keys to
00206              _schema are string property keys as used in project files.  Values
00207              are a list of four or five elements:
00208              [ is_list, property_type, is_strong, is_required, default ]
00209              is_list: True if the property described is a list, as opposed
00210                       to a single element.
00211              property_type: The type to use as the value of the property,
00212                             or if is_list is True, the type to use for each
00213                             element of the value's list.  property_type must
00214                             be an XCObject subclass, or one of the built-in
00215                             types str, int, or dict.
00216              is_strong: If property_type is an XCObject subclass, is_strong
00217                         is True to assert that this class "owns," or serves
00218                         as parent, to the property value (or, if is_list is
00219                         True, values).  is_strong must be False if
00220                         property_type is not an XCObject subclass.
00221              is_required: True if the property is required for the class.
00222                           Note that is_required being True does not preclude
00223                           an empty string ("", in the case of property_type
00224                           str) or list ([], in the case of is_list True) from
00225                           being set for the property.
00226              default: Optional.  If is_requried is True, default may be set
00227                       to provide a default value for objects that do not supply
00228                       their own value.  If is_required is True and default
00229                       is not provided, users of the class must supply their own
00230                       value for the property.
00231              Note that although the values of the array are expressed in
00232              boolean terms, subclasses provide values as integers to conserve
00233              horizontal space.
00234     _should_print_single_line: False in XCObject.  Subclasses whose objects
00235                                should be written to the project file in the
00236                                alternate single-line format, such as
00237                                PBXFileReference and PBXBuildFile, should
00238                                set this to True.
00239     _encode_transforms: Used by _EncodeString to encode unprintable characters.
00240                         The index into this list is the ordinal of the
00241                         character to transform; each value is a string
00242                         used to represent the character in the output.  XCObject
00243                         provides an _encode_transforms list suitable for most
00244                         XCObject subclasses.
00245     _alternate_encode_transforms: Provided for subclasses that wish to use
00246                                   the alternate encoding rules.  Xcode seems
00247                                   to use these rules when printing objects in
00248                                   single-line format.  Subclasses that desire
00249                                   this behavior should set _encode_transforms
00250                                   to _alternate_encode_transforms.
00251     _hashables: A list of XCObject subclasses that can be hashed by ComputeIDs
00252                 to construct this object's ID.  Most classes that need custom
00253                 hashing behavior should do it by overriding Hashables,
00254                 but in some cases an object's parent may wish to push a
00255                 hashable value into its child, and it can do so by appending
00256                 to _hashables.
00257   Attributes:
00258     id: The object's identifier, a 24-character uppercase hexadecimal string.
00259         Usually, objects being created should not set id until the entire
00260         project file structure is built.  At that point, UpdateIDs() should
00261         be called on the root object to assign deterministic values for id to
00262         each object in the tree.
00263     parent: The object's parent.  This is set by a parent XCObject when a child
00264             object is added to it.
00265     _properties: The object's property dictionary.  An object's properties are
00266                  described by its class' _schema variable.
00267   """
00268 
00269   _schema = {}
00270   _should_print_single_line = False
00271 
00272   # See _EncodeString.
00273   _encode_transforms = []
00274   i = 0
00275   while i < ord(' '):
00276     _encode_transforms.append('\\U%04x' % i)
00277     i = i + 1
00278   _encode_transforms[7] = '\\a'
00279   _encode_transforms[8] = '\\b'
00280   _encode_transforms[9] = '\\t'
00281   _encode_transforms[10] = '\\n'
00282   _encode_transforms[11] = '\\v'
00283   _encode_transforms[12] = '\\f'
00284   _encode_transforms[13] = '\\n'
00285 
00286   _alternate_encode_transforms = list(_encode_transforms)
00287   _alternate_encode_transforms[9] = chr(9)
00288   _alternate_encode_transforms[10] = chr(10)
00289   _alternate_encode_transforms[11] = chr(11)
00290 
00291   def __init__(self, properties=None, id=None, parent=None):
00292     self.id = id
00293     self.parent = parent
00294     self._properties = {}
00295     self._hashables = []
00296     self._SetDefaultsFromSchema()
00297     self.UpdateProperties(properties)
00298 
00299   def __repr__(self):
00300     try:
00301       name = self.Name()
00302     except NotImplementedError:
00303       return '<%s at 0x%x>' % (self.__class__.__name__, id(self))
00304     return '<%s %r at 0x%x>' % (self.__class__.__name__, name, id(self))
00305 
00306   def Copy(self):
00307     """Make a copy of this object.
00308 
00309     The new object will have its own copy of lists and dicts.  Any XCObject
00310     objects owned by this object (marked "strong") will be copied in the
00311     new object, even those found in lists.  If this object has any weak
00312     references to other XCObjects, the same references are added to the new
00313     object without making a copy.
00314     """
00315 
00316     that = self.__class__(id=self.id, parent=self.parent)
00317     for key, value in self._properties.iteritems():
00318       is_strong = self._schema[key][2]
00319 
00320       if isinstance(value, XCObject):
00321         if is_strong:
00322           new_value = value.Copy()
00323           new_value.parent = that
00324           that._properties[key] = new_value
00325         else:
00326           that._properties[key] = value
00327       elif isinstance(value, str) or isinstance(value, unicode) or \
00328            isinstance(value, int):
00329         that._properties[key] = value
00330       elif isinstance(value, list):
00331         if is_strong:
00332           # If is_strong is True, each element is an XCObject, so it's safe to
00333           # call Copy.
00334           that._properties[key] = []
00335           for item in value:
00336             new_item = item.Copy()
00337             new_item.parent = that
00338             that._properties[key].append(new_item)
00339         else:
00340           that._properties[key] = value[:]
00341       elif isinstance(value, dict):
00342         # dicts are never strong.
00343         if is_strong:
00344           raise TypeError('Strong dict for key ' + key + ' in ' + \
00345                           self.__class__.__name__)
00346         else:
00347           that._properties[key] = value.copy()
00348       else:
00349         raise TypeError('Unexpected type ' + value.__class__.__name__ + \
00350                         ' for key ' + key + ' in ' + self.__class__.__name__)
00351 
00352     return that
00353 
00354   def Name(self):
00355     """Return the name corresponding to an object.
00356 
00357     Not all objects necessarily need to be nameable, and not all that do have
00358     a "name" property.  Override as needed.
00359     """
00360 
00361     # If the schema indicates that "name" is required, try to access the
00362     # property even if it doesn't exist.  This will result in a KeyError
00363     # being raised for the property that should be present, which seems more
00364     # appropriate than NotImplementedError in this case.
00365     if 'name' in self._properties or \
00366         ('name' in self._schema and self._schema['name'][3]):
00367       return self._properties['name']
00368 
00369     raise NotImplementedError(self.__class__.__name__ + ' must implement Name')
00370 
00371   def Comment(self):
00372     """Return a comment string for the object.
00373 
00374     Most objects just use their name as the comment, but PBXProject uses
00375     different values.
00376 
00377     The returned comment is not escaped and does not have any comment marker
00378     strings applied to it.
00379     """
00380 
00381     return self.Name()
00382 
00383   def Hashables(self):
00384     hashables = [self.__class__.__name__]
00385 
00386     name = self.Name()
00387     if name != None:
00388       hashables.append(name)
00389 
00390     hashables.extend(self._hashables)
00391 
00392     return hashables
00393 
00394   def HashablesForChild(self):
00395     return None
00396 
00397   def ComputeIDs(self, recursive=True, overwrite=True, seed_hash=None):
00398     """Set "id" properties deterministically.
00399 
00400     An object's "id" property is set based on a hash of its class type and
00401     name, as well as the class type and name of all ancestor objects.  As
00402     such, it is only advisable to call ComputeIDs once an entire project file
00403     tree is built.
00404 
00405     If recursive is True, recurse into all descendant objects and update their
00406     hashes.
00407 
00408     If overwrite is True, any existing value set in the "id" property will be
00409     replaced.
00410     """
00411 
00412     def _HashUpdate(hash, data):
00413       """Update hash with data's length and contents.
00414 
00415       If the hash were updated only with the value of data, it would be
00416       possible for clowns to induce collisions by manipulating the names of
00417       their objects.  By adding the length, it's exceedingly less likely that
00418       ID collisions will be encountered, intentionally or not.
00419       """
00420 
00421       hash.update(struct.pack('>i', len(data)))
00422       hash.update(data)
00423 
00424     if seed_hash is None:
00425       seed_hash = _new_sha1()
00426 
00427     hash = seed_hash.copy()
00428 
00429     hashables = self.Hashables()
00430     assert len(hashables) > 0
00431     for hashable in hashables:
00432       _HashUpdate(hash, hashable)
00433 
00434     if recursive:
00435       hashables_for_child = self.HashablesForChild()
00436       if hashables_for_child is None:
00437         child_hash = hash
00438       else:
00439         assert len(hashables_for_child) > 0
00440         child_hash = seed_hash.copy()
00441         for hashable in hashables_for_child:
00442           _HashUpdate(child_hash, hashable)
00443 
00444       for child in self.Children():
00445         child.ComputeIDs(recursive, overwrite, child_hash)
00446 
00447     if overwrite or self.id is None:
00448       # Xcode IDs are only 96 bits (24 hex characters), but a SHA-1 digest is
00449       # is 160 bits.  Instead of throwing out 64 bits of the digest, xor them
00450       # into the portion that gets used.
00451       assert hash.digest_size % 4 == 0
00452       digest_int_count = hash.digest_size / 4
00453       digest_ints = struct.unpack('>' + 'I' * digest_int_count, hash.digest())
00454       id_ints = [0, 0, 0]
00455       for index in xrange(0, digest_int_count):
00456         id_ints[index % 3] ^= digest_ints[index]
00457       self.id = '%08X%08X%08X' % tuple(id_ints)
00458 
00459   def EnsureNoIDCollisions(self):
00460     """Verifies that no two objects have the same ID.  Checks all descendants.
00461     """
00462 
00463     ids = {}
00464     descendants = self.Descendants()
00465     for descendant in descendants:
00466       if descendant.id in ids:
00467         other = ids[descendant.id]
00468         raise KeyError(
00469               'Duplicate ID %s, objects "%s" and "%s" in "%s"' % \
00470               (descendant.id, str(descendant._properties),
00471                str(other._properties), self._properties['rootObject'].Name()))
00472       ids[descendant.id] = descendant
00473 
00474   def Children(self):
00475     """Returns a list of all of this object's owned (strong) children."""
00476 
00477     children = []
00478     for property, attributes in self._schema.iteritems():
00479       (is_list, property_type, is_strong) = attributes[0:3]
00480       if is_strong and property in self._properties:
00481         if not is_list:
00482           children.append(self._properties[property])
00483         else:
00484           children.extend(self._properties[property])
00485     return children
00486 
00487   def Descendants(self):
00488     """Returns a list of all of this object's descendants, including this
00489     object.
00490     """
00491 
00492     children = self.Children()
00493     descendants = [self]
00494     for child in children:
00495       descendants.extend(child.Descendants())
00496     return descendants
00497 
00498   def PBXProjectAncestor(self):
00499     # The base case for recursion is defined at PBXProject.PBXProjectAncestor.
00500     if self.parent:
00501       return self.parent.PBXProjectAncestor()
00502     return None
00503 
00504   def _EncodeComment(self, comment):
00505     """Encodes a comment to be placed in the project file output, mimicing
00506     Xcode behavior.
00507     """
00508 
00509     # This mimics Xcode behavior by wrapping the comment in "/*" and "*/".  If
00510     # the string already contains a "*/", it is turned into "(*)/".  This keeps
00511     # the file writer from outputting something that would be treated as the
00512     # end of a comment in the middle of something intended to be entirely a
00513     # comment.
00514 
00515     return '/* ' + comment.replace('*/', '(*)/') + ' */'
00516 
00517   def _EncodeTransform(self, match):
00518     # This function works closely with _EncodeString.  It will only be called
00519     # by re.sub with match.group(0) containing a character matched by the
00520     # the _escaped expression.
00521     char = match.group(0)
00522 
00523     # Backslashes (\) and quotation marks (") are always replaced with a
00524     # backslash-escaped version of the same.  Everything else gets its
00525     # replacement from the class' _encode_transforms array.
00526     if char == '\\':
00527       return '\\\\'
00528     if char == '"':
00529       return '\\"'
00530     return self._encode_transforms[ord(char)]
00531 
00532   def _EncodeString(self, value):
00533     """Encodes a string to be placed in the project file output, mimicing
00534     Xcode behavior.
00535     """
00536 
00537     # Use quotation marks when any character outside of the range A-Z, a-z, 0-9,
00538     # $ (dollar sign), . (period), and _ (underscore) is present.  Also use
00539     # quotation marks to represent empty strings.
00540     #
00541     # Escape " (double-quote) and \ (backslash) by preceding them with a
00542     # backslash.
00543     #
00544     # Some characters below the printable ASCII range are encoded specially:
00545     #     7 ^G BEL is encoded as "\a"
00546     #     8 ^H BS  is encoded as "\b"
00547     #    11 ^K VT  is encoded as "\v"
00548     #    12 ^L NP  is encoded as "\f"
00549     #   127 ^? DEL is passed through as-is without escaping
00550     #  - In PBXFileReference and PBXBuildFile objects:
00551     #     9 ^I HT  is passed through as-is without escaping
00552     #    10 ^J NL  is passed through as-is without escaping
00553     #    13 ^M CR  is passed through as-is without escaping
00554     #  - In other objects:
00555     #     9 ^I HT  is encoded as "\t"
00556     #    10 ^J NL  is encoded as "\n"
00557     #    13 ^M CR  is encoded as "\n" rendering it indistinguishable from
00558     #              10 ^J NL
00559     # All other characters within the ASCII control character range (0 through
00560     # 31 inclusive) are encoded as "\U001f" referring to the Unicode code point
00561     # in hexadecimal.  For example, character 14 (^N SO) is encoded as "\U000e".
00562     # Characters above the ASCII range are passed through to the output encoded
00563     # as UTF-8 without any escaping.  These mappings are contained in the
00564     # class' _encode_transforms list.
00565 
00566     if _unquoted.search(value) and not _quoted.search(value):
00567       return value
00568 
00569     return '"' + _escaped.sub(self._EncodeTransform, value) + '"'
00570 
00571   def _XCPrint(self, file, tabs, line):
00572     file.write('\t' * tabs + line)
00573 
00574   def _XCPrintableValue(self, tabs, value, flatten_list=False):
00575     """Returns a representation of value that may be printed in a project file,
00576     mimicing Xcode's behavior.
00577 
00578     _XCPrintableValue can handle str and int values, XCObjects (which are
00579     made printable by returning their id property), and list and dict objects
00580     composed of any of the above types.  When printing a list or dict, and
00581     _should_print_single_line is False, the tabs parameter is used to determine
00582     how much to indent the lines corresponding to the items in the list or
00583     dict.
00584 
00585     If flatten_list is True, single-element lists will be transformed into
00586     strings.
00587     """
00588 
00589     printable = ''
00590     comment = None
00591 
00592     if self._should_print_single_line:
00593       sep = ' '
00594       element_tabs = ''
00595       end_tabs = ''
00596     else:
00597       sep = '\n'
00598       element_tabs = '\t' * (tabs + 1)
00599       end_tabs = '\t' * tabs
00600 
00601     if isinstance(value, XCObject):
00602       printable += value.id
00603       comment = value.Comment()
00604     elif isinstance(value, str):
00605       printable += self._EncodeString(value)
00606     elif isinstance(value, unicode):
00607       printable += self._EncodeString(value.encode('utf-8'))
00608     elif isinstance(value, int):
00609       printable += str(value)
00610     elif isinstance(value, list):
00611       if flatten_list and len(value) <= 1:
00612         if len(value) == 0:
00613           printable += self._EncodeString('')
00614         else:
00615           printable += self._EncodeString(value[0])
00616       else:
00617         printable = '(' + sep
00618         for item in value:
00619           printable += element_tabs + \
00620                        self._XCPrintableValue(tabs + 1, item, flatten_list) + \
00621                        ',' + sep
00622         printable += end_tabs + ')'
00623     elif isinstance(value, dict):
00624       printable = '{' + sep
00625       for item_key, item_value in sorted(value.iteritems()):
00626         printable += element_tabs + \
00627             self._XCPrintableValue(tabs + 1, item_key, flatten_list) + ' = ' + \
00628             self._XCPrintableValue(tabs + 1, item_value, flatten_list) + ';' + \
00629             sep
00630       printable += end_tabs + '}'
00631     else:
00632       raise TypeError("Can't make " + value.__class__.__name__ + ' printable')
00633 
00634     if comment != None:
00635       printable += ' ' + self._EncodeComment(comment)
00636 
00637     return printable
00638 
00639   def _XCKVPrint(self, file, tabs, key, value):
00640     """Prints a key and value, members of an XCObject's _properties dictionary,
00641     to file.
00642 
00643     tabs is an int identifying the indentation level.  If the class'
00644     _should_print_single_line variable is True, tabs is ignored and the
00645     key-value pair will be followed by a space insead of a newline.
00646     """
00647 
00648     if self._should_print_single_line:
00649       printable = ''
00650       after_kv = ' '
00651     else:
00652       printable = '\t' * tabs
00653       after_kv = '\n'
00654 
00655     # Xcode usually prints remoteGlobalIDString values in PBXContainerItemProxy
00656     # objects without comments.  Sometimes it prints them with comments, but
00657     # the majority of the time, it doesn't.  To avoid unnecessary changes to
00658     # the project file after Xcode opens it, don't write comments for
00659     # remoteGlobalIDString.  This is a sucky hack and it would certainly be
00660     # cleaner to extend the schema to indicate whether or not a comment should
00661     # be printed, but since this is the only case where the problem occurs and
00662     # Xcode itself can't seem to make up its mind, the hack will suffice.
00663     #
00664     # Also see PBXContainerItemProxy._schema['remoteGlobalIDString'].
00665     if key == 'remoteGlobalIDString' and isinstance(self,
00666                                                     PBXContainerItemProxy):
00667       value_to_print = value.id
00668     else:
00669       value_to_print = value
00670 
00671     # PBXBuildFile's settings property is represented in the output as a dict,
00672     # but a hack here has it represented as a string. Arrange to strip off the
00673     # quotes so that it shows up in the output as expected.
00674     if key == 'settings' and isinstance(self, PBXBuildFile):
00675       strip_value_quotes = True
00676     else:
00677       strip_value_quotes = False
00678 
00679     # In another one-off, let's set flatten_list on buildSettings properties
00680     # of XCBuildConfiguration objects, because that's how Xcode treats them.
00681     if key == 'buildSettings' and isinstance(self, XCBuildConfiguration):
00682       flatten_list = True
00683     else:
00684       flatten_list = False
00685 
00686     try:
00687       printable_key = self._XCPrintableValue(tabs, key, flatten_list)
00688       printable_value = self._XCPrintableValue(tabs, value_to_print,
00689                                                flatten_list)
00690       if strip_value_quotes and len(printable_value) > 1 and \
00691           printable_value[0] == '"' and printable_value[-1] == '"':
00692         printable_value = printable_value[1:-1]
00693       printable += printable_key + ' = ' + printable_value + ';' + after_kv
00694     except TypeError, e:
00695       gyp.common.ExceptionAppend(e,
00696                                  'while printing key "%s"' % key)
00697       raise
00698 
00699     self._XCPrint(file, 0, printable)
00700 
00701   def Print(self, file=sys.stdout):
00702     """Prints a reprentation of this object to file, adhering to Xcode output
00703     formatting.
00704     """
00705 
00706     self.VerifyHasRequiredProperties()
00707 
00708     if self._should_print_single_line:
00709       # When printing an object in a single line, Xcode doesn't put any space
00710       # between the beginning of a dictionary (or presumably a list) and the
00711       # first contained item, so you wind up with snippets like
00712       #   ...CDEF = {isa = PBXFileReference; fileRef = 0123...
00713       # If it were me, I would have put a space in there after the opening
00714       # curly, but I guess this is just another one of those inconsistencies
00715       # between how Xcode prints PBXFileReference and PBXBuildFile objects as
00716       # compared to other objects.  Mimic Xcode's behavior here by using an
00717       # empty string for sep.
00718       sep = ''
00719       end_tabs = 0
00720     else:
00721       sep = '\n'
00722       end_tabs = 2
00723 
00724     # Start the object.  For example, '\t\tPBXProject = {\n'.
00725     self._XCPrint(file, 2, self._XCPrintableValue(2, self) + ' = {' + sep)
00726 
00727     # "isa" isn't in the _properties dictionary, it's an intrinsic property
00728     # of the class which the object belongs to.  Xcode always outputs "isa"
00729     # as the first element of an object dictionary.
00730     self._XCKVPrint(file, 3, 'isa', self.__class__.__name__)
00731 
00732     # The remaining elements of an object dictionary are sorted alphabetically.
00733     for property, value in sorted(self._properties.iteritems()):
00734       self._XCKVPrint(file, 3, property, value)
00735 
00736     # End the object.
00737     self._XCPrint(file, end_tabs, '};\n')
00738 
00739   def UpdateProperties(self, properties, do_copy=False):
00740     """Merge the supplied properties into the _properties dictionary.
00741 
00742     The input properties must adhere to the class schema or a KeyError or
00743     TypeError exception will be raised.  If adding an object of an XCObject
00744     subclass and the schema indicates a strong relationship, the object's
00745     parent will be set to this object.
00746 
00747     If do_copy is True, then lists, dicts, strong-owned XCObjects, and
00748     strong-owned XCObjects in lists will be copied instead of having their
00749     references added.
00750     """
00751 
00752     if properties is None:
00753       return
00754 
00755     for property, value in properties.iteritems():
00756       # Make sure the property is in the schema.
00757       if not property in self._schema:
00758         raise KeyError(property + ' not in ' + self.__class__.__name__)
00759 
00760       # Make sure the property conforms to the schema.
00761       (is_list, property_type, is_strong) = self._schema[property][0:3]
00762       if is_list:
00763         if value.__class__ != list:
00764           raise TypeError(
00765                 property + ' of ' + self.__class__.__name__ + \
00766                 ' must be list, not ' + value.__class__.__name__)
00767         for item in value:
00768           if not isinstance(item, property_type) and \
00769              not (item.__class__ == unicode and property_type == str):
00770             # Accept unicode where str is specified.  str is treated as
00771             # UTF-8-encoded.
00772             raise TypeError(
00773                   'item of ' + property + ' of ' + self.__class__.__name__ + \
00774                   ' must be ' + property_type.__name__ + ', not ' + \
00775                   item.__class__.__name__)
00776       elif not isinstance(value, property_type) and \
00777            not (value.__class__ == unicode and property_type == str):
00778         # Accept unicode where str is specified.  str is treated as
00779         # UTF-8-encoded.
00780         raise TypeError(
00781               property + ' of ' + self.__class__.__name__ + ' must be ' + \
00782               property_type.__name__ + ', not ' + value.__class__.__name__)
00783 
00784       # Checks passed, perform the assignment.
00785       if do_copy:
00786         if isinstance(value, XCObject):
00787           if is_strong:
00788             self._properties[property] = value.Copy()
00789           else:
00790             self._properties[property] = value
00791         elif isinstance(value, str) or isinstance(value, unicode) or \
00792              isinstance(value, int):
00793           self._properties[property] = value
00794         elif isinstance(value, list):
00795           if is_strong:
00796             # If is_strong is True, each element is an XCObject, so it's safe
00797             # to call Copy.
00798             self._properties[property] = []
00799             for item in value:
00800               self._properties[property].append(item.Copy())
00801           else:
00802             self._properties[property] = value[:]
00803         elif isinstance(value, dict):
00804           self._properties[property] = value.copy()
00805         else:
00806           raise TypeError("Don't know how to copy a " + \
00807                           value.__class__.__name__ + ' object for ' + \
00808                           property + ' in ' + self.__class__.__name__)
00809       else:
00810         self._properties[property] = value
00811 
00812       # Set up the child's back-reference to this object.  Don't use |value|
00813       # any more because it may not be right if do_copy is true.
00814       if is_strong:
00815         if not is_list:
00816           self._properties[property].parent = self
00817         else:
00818           for item in self._properties[property]:
00819             item.parent = self
00820 
00821   def HasProperty(self, key):
00822     return key in self._properties
00823 
00824   def GetProperty(self, key):
00825     return self._properties[key]
00826 
00827   def SetProperty(self, key, value):
00828     self.UpdateProperties({key: value})
00829 
00830   def DelProperty(self, key):
00831     if key in self._properties:
00832       del self._properties[key]
00833 
00834   def AppendProperty(self, key, value):
00835     # TODO(mark): Support ExtendProperty too (and make this call that)?
00836 
00837     # Schema validation.
00838     if not key in self._schema:
00839       raise KeyError(key + ' not in ' + self.__class__.__name__)
00840 
00841     (is_list, property_type, is_strong) = self._schema[key][0:3]
00842     if not is_list:
00843       raise TypeError(key + ' of ' + self.__class__.__name__ + ' must be list')
00844     if not isinstance(value, property_type):
00845       raise TypeError('item of ' + key + ' of ' + self.__class__.__name__ + \
00846                       ' must be ' + property_type.__name__ + ', not ' + \
00847                       value.__class__.__name__)
00848 
00849     # If the property doesn't exist yet, create a new empty list to receive the
00850     # item.
00851     if not key in self._properties:
00852       self._properties[key] = []
00853 
00854     # Set up the ownership link.
00855     if is_strong:
00856       value.parent = self
00857 
00858     # Store the item.
00859     self._properties[key].append(value)
00860 
00861   def VerifyHasRequiredProperties(self):
00862     """Ensure that all properties identified as required by the schema are
00863     set.
00864     """
00865 
00866     # TODO(mark): A stronger verification mechanism is needed.  Some
00867     # subclasses need to perform validation beyond what the schema can enforce.
00868     for property, attributes in self._schema.iteritems():
00869       (is_list, property_type, is_strong, is_required) = attributes[0:4]
00870       if is_required and not property in self._properties:
00871         raise KeyError(self.__class__.__name__ + ' requires ' + property)
00872 
00873   def _SetDefaultsFromSchema(self):
00874     """Assign object default values according to the schema.  This will not
00875     overwrite properties that have already been set."""
00876 
00877     defaults = {}
00878     for property, attributes in self._schema.iteritems():
00879       (is_list, property_type, is_strong, is_required) = attributes[0:4]
00880       if is_required and len(attributes) >= 5 and \
00881           not property in self._properties:
00882         default = attributes[4]
00883 
00884         defaults[property] = default
00885 
00886     if len(defaults) > 0:
00887       # Use do_copy=True so that each new object gets its own copy of strong
00888       # objects, lists, and dicts.
00889       self.UpdateProperties(defaults, do_copy=True)
00890 
00891 
00892 class XCHierarchicalElement(XCObject):
00893   """Abstract base for PBXGroup and PBXFileReference.  Not represented in a
00894   project file."""
00895 
00896   # TODO(mark): Do name and path belong here?  Probably so.
00897   # If path is set and name is not, name may have a default value.  Name will
00898   # be set to the basename of path, if the basename of path is different from
00899   # the full value of path.  If path is already just a leaf name, name will
00900   # not be set.
00901   _schema = XCObject._schema.copy()
00902   _schema.update({
00903     'comments':       [0, str, 0, 0],
00904     'fileEncoding':   [0, str, 0, 0],
00905     'includeInIndex': [0, int, 0, 0],
00906     'indentWidth':    [0, int, 0, 0],
00907     'lineEnding':     [0, int, 0, 0],
00908     'sourceTree':     [0, str, 0, 1, '<group>'],
00909     'tabWidth':       [0, int, 0, 0],
00910     'usesTabs':       [0, int, 0, 0],
00911     'wrapsLines':     [0, int, 0, 0],
00912   })
00913 
00914   def __init__(self, properties=None, id=None, parent=None):
00915     # super
00916     XCObject.__init__(self, properties, id, parent)
00917     if 'path' in self._properties and not 'name' in self._properties:
00918       path = self._properties['path']
00919       name = posixpath.basename(path)
00920       if name != '' and path != name:
00921         self.SetProperty('name', name)
00922 
00923     if 'path' in self._properties and \
00924         (not 'sourceTree' in self._properties or \
00925          self._properties['sourceTree'] == '<group>'):
00926       # If the pathname begins with an Xcode variable like "$(SDKROOT)/", take
00927       # the variable out and make the path be relative to that variable by
00928       # assigning the variable name as the sourceTree.
00929       (source_tree, path) = SourceTreeAndPathFromPath(self._properties['path'])
00930       if source_tree != None:
00931         self._properties['sourceTree'] = source_tree
00932       if path != None:
00933         self._properties['path'] = path
00934       if source_tree != None and path is None and \
00935          not 'name' in self._properties:
00936         # The path was of the form "$(SDKROOT)" with no path following it.
00937         # This object is now relative to that variable, so it has no path
00938         # attribute of its own.  It does, however, keep a name.
00939         del self._properties['path']
00940         self._properties['name'] = source_tree
00941 
00942   def Name(self):
00943     if 'name' in self._properties:
00944       return self._properties['name']
00945     elif 'path' in self._properties:
00946       return self._properties['path']
00947     else:
00948       # This happens in the case of the root PBXGroup.
00949       return None
00950 
00951   def Hashables(self):
00952     """Custom hashables for XCHierarchicalElements.
00953 
00954     XCHierarchicalElements are special.  Generally, their hashes shouldn't
00955     change if the paths don't change.  The normal XCObject implementation of
00956     Hashables adds a hashable for each object, which means that if
00957     the hierarchical structure changes (possibly due to changes caused when
00958     TakeOverOnlyChild runs and encounters slight changes in the hierarchy),
00959     the hashes will change.  For example, if a project file initially contains
00960     a/b/f1 and a/b becomes collapsed into a/b, f1 will have a single parent
00961     a/b.  If someone later adds a/f2 to the project file, a/b can no longer be
00962     collapsed, and f1 winds up with parent b and grandparent a.  That would
00963     be sufficient to change f1's hash.
00964 
00965     To counteract this problem, hashables for all XCHierarchicalElements except
00966     for the main group (which has neither a name nor a path) are taken to be
00967     just the set of path components.  Because hashables are inherited from
00968     parents, this provides assurance that a/b/f1 has the same set of hashables
00969     whether its parent is b or a/b.
00970 
00971     The main group is a special case.  As it is permitted to have no name or
00972     path, it is permitted to use the standard XCObject hash mechanism.  This
00973     is not considered a problem because there can be only one main group.
00974     """
00975 
00976     if self == self.PBXProjectAncestor()._properties['mainGroup']:
00977       # super
00978       return XCObject.Hashables(self)
00979 
00980     hashables = []
00981 
00982     # Put the name in first, ensuring that if TakeOverOnlyChild collapses
00983     # children into a top-level group like "Source", the name always goes
00984     # into the list of hashables without interfering with path components.
00985     if 'name' in self._properties:
00986       # Make it less likely for people to manipulate hashes by following the
00987       # pattern of always pushing an object type value onto the list first.
00988       hashables.append(self.__class__.__name__ + '.name')
00989       hashables.append(self._properties['name'])
00990 
00991     # NOTE: This still has the problem that if an absolute path is encountered,
00992     # including paths with a sourceTree, they'll still inherit their parents'
00993     # hashables, even though the paths aren't relative to their parents.  This
00994     # is not expected to be much of a problem in practice.
00995     path = self.PathFromSourceTreeAndPath()
00996     if path != None:
00997       components = path.split(posixpath.sep)
00998       for component in components:
00999         hashables.append(self.__class__.__name__ + '.path')
01000         hashables.append(component)
01001 
01002     hashables.extend(self._hashables)
01003 
01004     return hashables
01005 
01006   def Compare(self, other):
01007     # Allow comparison of these types.  PBXGroup has the highest sort rank;
01008     # PBXVariantGroup is treated as equal to PBXFileReference.
01009     valid_class_types = {
01010       PBXFileReference: 'file',
01011       PBXGroup:         'group',
01012       PBXVariantGroup:  'file',
01013     }
01014     self_type = valid_class_types[self.__class__]
01015     other_type = valid_class_types[other.__class__]
01016 
01017     if self_type == other_type:
01018       # If the two objects are of the same sort rank, compare their names.
01019       return cmp(self.Name(), other.Name())
01020 
01021     # Otherwise, sort groups before everything else.
01022     if self_type == 'group':
01023       return -1
01024     return 1
01025 
01026   def CompareRootGroup(self, other):
01027     # This function should be used only to compare direct children of the
01028     # containing PBXProject's mainGroup.  These groups should appear in the
01029     # listed order.
01030     # TODO(mark): "Build" is used by gyp.generator.xcode, perhaps the
01031     # generator should have a way of influencing this list rather than having
01032     # to hardcode for the generator here.
01033     order = ['Source', 'Intermediates', 'Projects', 'Frameworks', 'Products',
01034              'Build']
01035 
01036     # If the groups aren't in the listed order, do a name comparison.
01037     # Otherwise, groups in the listed order should come before those that
01038     # aren't.
01039     self_name = self.Name()
01040     other_name = other.Name()
01041     self_in = isinstance(self, PBXGroup) and self_name in order
01042     other_in = isinstance(self, PBXGroup) and other_name in order
01043     if not self_in and not other_in:
01044       return self.Compare(other)
01045     if self_name in order and not other_name in order:
01046       return -1
01047     if other_name in order and not self_name in order:
01048       return 1
01049 
01050     # If both groups are in the listed order, go by the defined order.
01051     self_index = order.index(self_name)
01052     other_index = order.index(other_name)
01053     if self_index < other_index:
01054       return -1
01055     if self_index > other_index:
01056       return 1
01057     return 0
01058 
01059   def PathFromSourceTreeAndPath(self):
01060     # Turn the object's sourceTree and path properties into a single flat
01061     # string of a form comparable to the path parameter.  If there's a
01062     # sourceTree property other than "<group>", wrap it in $(...) for the
01063     # comparison.
01064     components = []
01065     if self._properties['sourceTree'] != '<group>':
01066       components.append('$(' + self._properties['sourceTree'] + ')')
01067     if 'path' in self._properties:
01068       components.append(self._properties['path'])
01069 
01070     if len(components) > 0:
01071       return posixpath.join(*components)
01072 
01073     return None
01074 
01075   def FullPath(self):
01076     # Returns a full path to self relative to the project file, or relative
01077     # to some other source tree.  Start with self, and walk up the chain of
01078     # parents prepending their paths, if any, until no more parents are
01079     # available (project-relative path) or until a path relative to some
01080     # source tree is found.
01081     xche = self
01082     path = None
01083     while isinstance(xche, XCHierarchicalElement) and \
01084           (path is None or \
01085            (not path.startswith('/') and not path.startswith('$'))):
01086       this_path = xche.PathFromSourceTreeAndPath()
01087       if this_path != None and path != None:
01088         path = posixpath.join(this_path, path)
01089       elif this_path != None:
01090         path = this_path
01091       xche = xche.parent
01092 
01093     return path
01094 
01095 
01096 class PBXGroup(XCHierarchicalElement):
01097   """
01098   Attributes:
01099     _children_by_path: Maps pathnames of children of this PBXGroup to the
01100       actual child XCHierarchicalElement objects.
01101     _variant_children_by_name_and_path: Maps (name, path) tuples of
01102       PBXVariantGroup children to the actual child PBXVariantGroup objects.
01103   """
01104 
01105   _schema = XCHierarchicalElement._schema.copy()
01106   _schema.update({
01107     'children': [1, XCHierarchicalElement, 1, 1, []],
01108     'name':     [0, str,                   0, 0],
01109     'path':     [0, str,                   0, 0],
01110   })
01111 
01112   def __init__(self, properties=None, id=None, parent=None):
01113     # super
01114     XCHierarchicalElement.__init__(self, properties, id, parent)
01115     self._children_by_path = {}
01116     self._variant_children_by_name_and_path = {}
01117     for child in self._properties.get('children', []):
01118       self._AddChildToDicts(child)
01119 
01120   def Hashables(self):
01121     # super
01122     hashables = XCHierarchicalElement.Hashables(self)
01123 
01124     # It is not sufficient to just rely on name and parent to build a unique
01125     # hashable : a node could have two child PBXGroup sharing a common name.
01126     # To add entropy the hashable is enhanced with the names of all its
01127     # children.
01128     for child in self._properties.get('children', []):
01129       child_name = child.Name()
01130       if child_name != None:
01131         hashables.append(child_name)
01132 
01133     return hashables
01134 
01135   def HashablesForChild(self):
01136     # To avoid a circular reference the hashables used to compute a child id do
01137     # not include the child names.
01138     return XCHierarchicalElement.Hashables(self)
01139 
01140   def _AddChildToDicts(self, child):
01141     # Sets up this PBXGroup object's dicts to reference the child properly.
01142     child_path = child.PathFromSourceTreeAndPath()
01143     if child_path:
01144       if child_path in self._children_by_path:
01145         raise ValueError('Found multiple children with path ' + child_path)
01146       self._children_by_path[child_path] = child
01147 
01148     if isinstance(child, PBXVariantGroup):
01149       child_name = child._properties.get('name', None)
01150       key = (child_name, child_path)
01151       if key in self._variant_children_by_name_and_path:
01152         raise ValueError('Found multiple PBXVariantGroup children with ' + \
01153                          'name ' + str(child_name) + ' and path ' + \
01154                          str(child_path))
01155       self._variant_children_by_name_and_path[key] = child
01156 
01157   def AppendChild(self, child):
01158     # Callers should use this instead of calling
01159     # AppendProperty('children', child) directly because this function
01160     # maintains the group's dicts.
01161     self.AppendProperty('children', child)
01162     self._AddChildToDicts(child)
01163 
01164   def GetChildByName(self, name):
01165     # This is not currently optimized with a dict as GetChildByPath is because
01166     # it has few callers.  Most callers probably want GetChildByPath.  This
01167     # function is only useful to get children that have names but no paths,
01168     # which is rare.  The children of the main group ("Source", "Products",
01169     # etc.) is pretty much the only case where this likely to come up.
01170     #
01171     # TODO(mark): Maybe this should raise an error if more than one child is
01172     # present with the same name.
01173     if not 'children' in self._properties:
01174       return None
01175 
01176     for child in self._properties['children']:
01177       if child.Name() == name:
01178         return child
01179 
01180     return None
01181 
01182   def GetChildByPath(self, path):
01183     if not path:
01184       return None
01185 
01186     if path in self._children_by_path:
01187       return self._children_by_path[path]
01188 
01189     return None
01190 
01191   def GetChildByRemoteObject(self, remote_object):
01192     # This method is a little bit esoteric.  Given a remote_object, which
01193     # should be a PBXFileReference in another project file, this method will
01194     # return this group's PBXReferenceProxy object serving as a local proxy
01195     # for the remote PBXFileReference.
01196     #
01197     # This function might benefit from a dict optimization as GetChildByPath
01198     # for some workloads, but profiling shows that it's not currently a
01199     # problem.
01200     if not 'children' in self._properties:
01201       return None
01202 
01203     for child in self._properties['children']:
01204       if not isinstance(child, PBXReferenceProxy):
01205         continue
01206 
01207       container_proxy = child._properties['remoteRef']
01208       if container_proxy._properties['remoteGlobalIDString'] == remote_object:
01209         return child
01210 
01211     return None
01212 
01213   def AddOrGetFileByPath(self, path, hierarchical):
01214     """Returns an existing or new file reference corresponding to path.
01215 
01216     If hierarchical is True, this method will create or use the necessary
01217     hierarchical group structure corresponding to path.  Otherwise, it will
01218     look in and create an item in the current group only.
01219 
01220     If an existing matching reference is found, it is returned, otherwise, a
01221     new one will be created, added to the correct group, and returned.
01222 
01223     If path identifies a directory by virtue of carrying a trailing slash,
01224     this method returns a PBXFileReference of "folder" type.  If path
01225     identifies a variant, by virtue of it identifying a file inside a directory
01226     with an ".lproj" extension, this method returns a PBXVariantGroup
01227     containing the variant named by path, and possibly other variants.  For
01228     all other paths, a "normal" PBXFileReference will be returned.
01229     """
01230 
01231     # Adding or getting a directory?  Directories end with a trailing slash.
01232     is_dir = False
01233     if path.endswith('/'):
01234       is_dir = True
01235     path = posixpath.normpath(path)
01236     if is_dir:
01237       path = path + '/'
01238 
01239     # Adding or getting a variant?  Variants are files inside directories
01240     # with an ".lproj" extension.  Xcode uses variants for localization.  For
01241     # a variant path/to/Language.lproj/MainMenu.nib, put a variant group named
01242     # MainMenu.nib inside path/to, and give it a variant named Language.  In
01243     # this example, grandparent would be set to path/to and parent_root would
01244     # be set to Language.
01245     variant_name = None
01246     parent = posixpath.dirname(path)
01247     grandparent = posixpath.dirname(parent)
01248     parent_basename = posixpath.basename(parent)
01249     (parent_root, parent_ext) = posixpath.splitext(parent_basename)
01250     if parent_ext == '.lproj':
01251       variant_name = parent_root
01252     if grandparent == '':
01253       grandparent = None
01254 
01255     # Putting a directory inside a variant group is not currently supported.
01256     assert not is_dir or variant_name is None
01257 
01258     path_split = path.split(posixpath.sep)
01259     if len(path_split) == 1 or \
01260        ((is_dir or variant_name != None) and len(path_split) == 2) or \
01261        not hierarchical:
01262       # The PBXFileReference or PBXVariantGroup will be added to or gotten from
01263       # this PBXGroup, no recursion necessary.
01264       if variant_name is None:
01265         # Add or get a PBXFileReference.
01266         file_ref = self.GetChildByPath(path)
01267         if file_ref != None:
01268           assert file_ref.__class__ == PBXFileReference
01269         else:
01270           file_ref = PBXFileReference({'path': path})
01271           self.AppendChild(file_ref)
01272       else:
01273         # Add or get a PBXVariantGroup.  The variant group name is the same
01274         # as the basename (MainMenu.nib in the example above).  grandparent
01275         # specifies the path to the variant group itself, and path_split[-2:]
01276         # is the path of the specific variant relative to its group.
01277         variant_group_name = posixpath.basename(path)
01278         variant_group_ref = self.AddOrGetVariantGroupByNameAndPath(
01279             variant_group_name, grandparent)
01280         variant_path = posixpath.sep.join(path_split[-2:])
01281         variant_ref = variant_group_ref.GetChildByPath(variant_path)
01282         if variant_ref != None:
01283           assert variant_ref.__class__ == PBXFileReference
01284         else:
01285           variant_ref = PBXFileReference({'name': variant_name,
01286                                           'path': variant_path})
01287           variant_group_ref.AppendChild(variant_ref)
01288         # The caller is interested in the variant group, not the specific
01289         # variant file.
01290         file_ref = variant_group_ref
01291       return file_ref
01292     else:
01293       # Hierarchical recursion.  Add or get a PBXGroup corresponding to the
01294       # outermost path component, and then recurse into it, chopping off that
01295       # path component.
01296       next_dir = path_split[0]
01297       group_ref = self.GetChildByPath(next_dir)
01298       if group_ref != None:
01299         assert group_ref.__class__ == PBXGroup
01300       else:
01301         group_ref = PBXGroup({'path': next_dir})
01302         self.AppendChild(group_ref)
01303       return group_ref.AddOrGetFileByPath(posixpath.sep.join(path_split[1:]),
01304                                           hierarchical)
01305 
01306   def AddOrGetVariantGroupByNameAndPath(self, name, path):
01307     """Returns an existing or new PBXVariantGroup for name and path.
01308 
01309     If a PBXVariantGroup identified by the name and path arguments is already
01310     present as a child of this object, it is returned.  Otherwise, a new
01311     PBXVariantGroup with the correct properties is created, added as a child,
01312     and returned.
01313 
01314     This method will generally be called by AddOrGetFileByPath, which knows
01315     when to create a variant group based on the structure of the pathnames
01316     passed to it.
01317     """
01318 
01319     key = (name, path)
01320     if key in self._variant_children_by_name_and_path:
01321       variant_group_ref = self._variant_children_by_name_and_path[key]
01322       assert variant_group_ref.__class__ == PBXVariantGroup
01323       return variant_group_ref
01324 
01325     variant_group_properties = {'name': name}
01326     if path != None:
01327       variant_group_properties['path'] = path
01328     variant_group_ref = PBXVariantGroup(variant_group_properties)
01329     self.AppendChild(variant_group_ref)
01330 
01331     return variant_group_ref
01332 
01333   def TakeOverOnlyChild(self, recurse=False):
01334     """If this PBXGroup has only one child and it's also a PBXGroup, take
01335     it over by making all of its children this object's children.
01336 
01337     This function will continue to take over only children when those children
01338     are groups.  If there are three PBXGroups representing a, b, and c, with
01339     c inside b and b inside a, and a and b have no other children, this will
01340     result in a taking over both b and c, forming a PBXGroup for a/b/c.
01341 
01342     If recurse is True, this function will recurse into children and ask them
01343     to collapse themselves by taking over only children as well.  Assuming
01344     an example hierarchy with files at a/b/c/d1, a/b/c/d2, and a/b/c/d3/e/f
01345     (d1, d2, and f are files, the rest are groups), recursion will result in
01346     a group for a/b/c containing a group for d3/e.
01347     """
01348 
01349     # At this stage, check that child class types are PBXGroup exactly,
01350     # instead of using isinstance.  The only subclass of PBXGroup,
01351     # PBXVariantGroup, should not participate in reparenting in the same way:
01352     # reparenting by merging different object types would be wrong.
01353     while len(self._properties['children']) == 1 and \
01354           self._properties['children'][0].__class__ == PBXGroup:
01355       # Loop to take over the innermost only-child group possible.
01356 
01357       child = self._properties['children'][0]
01358 
01359       # Assume the child's properties, including its children.  Save a copy
01360       # of this object's old properties, because they'll still be needed.
01361       # This object retains its existing id and parent attributes.
01362       old_properties = self._properties
01363       self._properties = child._properties
01364       self._children_by_path = child._children_by_path
01365 
01366       if not 'sourceTree' in self._properties or \
01367          self._properties['sourceTree'] == '<group>':
01368         # The child was relative to its parent.  Fix up the path.  Note that
01369         # children with a sourceTree other than "<group>" are not relative to
01370         # their parents, so no path fix-up is needed in that case.
01371         if 'path' in old_properties:
01372           if 'path' in self._properties:
01373             # Both the original parent and child have paths set.
01374             self._properties['path'] = posixpath.join(old_properties['path'],
01375                                                       self._properties['path'])
01376           else:
01377             # Only the original parent has a path, use it.
01378             self._properties['path'] = old_properties['path']
01379         if 'sourceTree' in old_properties:
01380           # The original parent had a sourceTree set, use it.
01381           self._properties['sourceTree'] = old_properties['sourceTree']
01382 
01383       # If the original parent had a name set, keep using it.  If the original
01384       # parent didn't have a name but the child did, let the child's name
01385       # live on.  If the name attribute seems unnecessary now, get rid of it.
01386       if 'name' in old_properties and old_properties['name'] != None and \
01387          old_properties['name'] != self.Name():
01388         self._properties['name'] = old_properties['name']
01389       if 'name' in self._properties and 'path' in self._properties and \
01390          self._properties['name'] == self._properties['path']:
01391         del self._properties['name']
01392 
01393       # Notify all children of their new parent.
01394       for child in self._properties['children']:
01395         child.parent = self
01396 
01397     # If asked to recurse, recurse.
01398     if recurse:
01399       for child in self._properties['children']:
01400         if child.__class__ == PBXGroup:
01401           child.TakeOverOnlyChild(recurse)
01402 
01403   def SortGroup(self):
01404     self._properties['children'] = \
01405         sorted(self._properties['children'], cmp=lambda x,y: x.Compare(y))
01406 
01407     # Recurse.
01408     for child in self._properties['children']:
01409       if isinstance(child, PBXGroup):
01410         child.SortGroup()
01411 
01412 
01413 class XCFileLikeElement(XCHierarchicalElement):
01414   # Abstract base for objects that can be used as the fileRef property of
01415   # PBXBuildFile.
01416 
01417   def PathHashables(self):
01418     # A PBXBuildFile that refers to this object will call this method to
01419     # obtain additional hashables specific to this XCFileLikeElement.  Don't
01420     # just use this object's hashables, they're not specific and unique enough
01421     # on their own (without access to the parent hashables.)  Instead, provide
01422     # hashables that identify this object by path by getting its hashables as
01423     # well as the hashables of ancestor XCHierarchicalElement objects.
01424 
01425     hashables = []
01426     xche = self
01427     while xche != None and isinstance(xche, XCHierarchicalElement):
01428       xche_hashables = xche.Hashables()
01429       for index in xrange(0, len(xche_hashables)):
01430         hashables.insert(index, xche_hashables[index])
01431       xche = xche.parent
01432     return hashables
01433 
01434 
01435 class XCContainerPortal(XCObject):
01436   # Abstract base for objects that can be used as the containerPortal property
01437   # of PBXContainerItemProxy.
01438   pass
01439 
01440 
01441 class XCRemoteObject(XCObject):
01442   # Abstract base for objects that can be used as the remoteGlobalIDString
01443   # property of PBXContainerItemProxy.
01444   pass
01445 
01446 
01447 class PBXFileReference(XCFileLikeElement, XCContainerPortal, XCRemoteObject):
01448   _schema = XCFileLikeElement._schema.copy()
01449   _schema.update({
01450     'explicitFileType':  [0, str, 0, 0],
01451     'lastKnownFileType': [0, str, 0, 0],
01452     'name':              [0, str, 0, 0],
01453     'path':              [0, str, 0, 1],
01454   })
01455 
01456   # Weird output rules for PBXFileReference.
01457   _should_print_single_line = True
01458   # super
01459   _encode_transforms = XCFileLikeElement._alternate_encode_transforms
01460 
01461   def __init__(self, properties=None, id=None, parent=None):
01462     # super
01463     XCFileLikeElement.__init__(self, properties, id, parent)
01464     if 'path' in self._properties and self._properties['path'].endswith('/'):
01465       self._properties['path'] = self._properties['path'][:-1]
01466       is_dir = True
01467     else:
01468       is_dir = False
01469 
01470     if 'path' in self._properties and \
01471         not 'lastKnownFileType' in self._properties and \
01472         not 'explicitFileType' in self._properties:
01473       # TODO(mark): This is the replacement for a replacement for a quick hack.
01474       # It is no longer incredibly sucky, but this list needs to be extended.
01475       extension_map = {
01476         'a':           'archive.ar',
01477         'app':         'wrapper.application',
01478         'bdic':        'file',
01479         'bundle':      'wrapper.cfbundle',
01480         'c':           'sourcecode.c.c',
01481         'cc':          'sourcecode.cpp.cpp',
01482         'cpp':         'sourcecode.cpp.cpp',
01483         'css':         'text.css',
01484         'cxx':         'sourcecode.cpp.cpp',
01485         'dart':        'sourcecode',
01486         'dylib':       'compiled.mach-o.dylib',
01487         'framework':   'wrapper.framework',
01488         'gyp':         'sourcecode',
01489         'gypi':        'sourcecode',
01490         'h':           'sourcecode.c.h',
01491         'hxx':         'sourcecode.cpp.h',
01492         'icns':        'image.icns',
01493         'java':        'sourcecode.java',
01494         'js':          'sourcecode.javascript',
01495         'm':           'sourcecode.c.objc',
01496         'mm':          'sourcecode.cpp.objcpp',
01497         'nib':         'wrapper.nib',
01498         'o':           'compiled.mach-o.objfile',
01499         'pdf':         'image.pdf',
01500         'pl':          'text.script.perl',
01501         'plist':       'text.plist.xml',
01502         'pm':          'text.script.perl',
01503         'png':         'image.png',
01504         'py':          'text.script.python',
01505         'r':           'sourcecode.rez',
01506         'rez':         'sourcecode.rez',
01507         's':           'sourcecode.asm',
01508         'storyboard':  'file.storyboard',
01509         'strings':     'text.plist.strings',
01510         'swift':       'sourcecode.swift',
01511         'ttf':         'file',
01512         'xcassets':    'folder.assetcatalog',
01513         'xcconfig':    'text.xcconfig',
01514         'xcdatamodel': 'wrapper.xcdatamodel',
01515         'xcdatamodeld':'wrapper.xcdatamodeld',
01516         'xib':         'file.xib',
01517         'y':           'sourcecode.yacc',
01518       }
01519 
01520       prop_map = {
01521         'dart':        'explicitFileType',
01522         'gyp':         'explicitFileType',
01523         'gypi':        'explicitFileType',
01524       }
01525 
01526       if is_dir:
01527         file_type = 'folder'
01528         prop_name = 'lastKnownFileType'
01529       else:
01530         basename = posixpath.basename(self._properties['path'])
01531         (root, ext) = posixpath.splitext(basename)
01532         # Check the map using a lowercase extension.
01533         # TODO(mark): Maybe it should try with the original case first and fall
01534         # back to lowercase, in case there are any instances where case
01535         # matters.  There currently aren't.
01536         if ext != '':
01537           ext = ext[1:].lower()
01538 
01539         # TODO(mark): "text" is the default value, but "file" is appropriate
01540         # for unrecognized files not containing text.  Xcode seems to choose
01541         # based on content.
01542         file_type = extension_map.get(ext, 'text')
01543         prop_name = prop_map.get(ext, 'lastKnownFileType')
01544 
01545       self._properties[prop_name] = file_type
01546 
01547 
01548 class PBXVariantGroup(PBXGroup, XCFileLikeElement):
01549   """PBXVariantGroup is used by Xcode to represent localizations."""
01550   # No additions to the schema relative to PBXGroup.
01551   pass

01555 # because it uses PBXContainerItemProxy, defined below.
