01558 class XCBuildConfiguration(XCObject):
01559   _schema = XCObject._schema.copy()
01560   _schema.update({
01561     'baseConfigurationReference': [0, PBXFileReference, 0, 0],
01562     'buildSettings':              [0, dict, 0, 1, {}],
01563     'name':                       [0, str,  0, 1],
01564   })
01565 
01566   def HasBuildSetting(self, key):
01567     return key in self._properties['buildSettings']
01568 
01569   def GetBuildSetting(self, key):
01570     return self._properties['buildSettings'][key]
01571 
01572   def SetBuildSetting(self, key, value):
01573     # TODO(mark): If a list, copy?
01574     self._properties['buildSettings'][key] = value
01575 
01576   def AppendBuildSetting(self, key, value):
01577     if not key in self._properties['buildSettings']:
01578       self._properties['buildSettings'][key] = []
01579     self._properties['buildSettings'][key].append(value)
01580 
01581   def DelBuildSetting(self, key):
01582     if key in self._properties['buildSettings']:
01583       del self._properties['buildSettings'][key]
01584 
01585   def SetBaseConfiguration(self, value):
01586     self._properties['baseConfigurationReference'] = value
01587 
01588 class XCConfigurationList(XCObject):
01589   # _configs is the default list of configurations.
01590   _configs = [ XCBuildConfiguration({'name': 'Debug'}),
01591                XCBuildConfiguration({'name': 'Release'}) ]
01592 
01593   _schema = XCObject._schema.copy()
01594   _schema.update({
01595     'buildConfigurations':           [1, XCBuildConfiguration, 1, 1, _configs],
01596     'defaultConfigurationIsVisible': [0, int,                  0, 1, 1],
01597     'defaultConfigurationName':      [0, str,                  0, 1, 'Release'],
01598   })
01599 
01600   def Name(self):
01601     return 'Build configuration list for ' + \
01602            self.parent.__class__.__name__ + ' "' + self.parent.Name() + '"'
01603 
01604   def ConfigurationNamed(self, name):
01605     """Convenience accessor to obtain an XCBuildConfiguration by name."""
01606     for configuration in self._properties['buildConfigurations']:
01607       if configuration._properties['name'] == name:
01608         return configuration
01609 
01610     raise KeyError(name)
01611 
01612   def DefaultConfiguration(self):
01613     """Convenience accessor to obtain the default XCBuildConfiguration."""
01614     return self.ConfigurationNamed(self._properties['defaultConfigurationName'])
01615 
01616   def HasBuildSetting(self, key):
01617     """Determines the state of a build setting in all XCBuildConfiguration
01618     child objects.
01619 
01620     If all child objects have key in their build settings, and the value is the
01621     same in all child objects, returns 1.
01622 
01623     If no child objects have the key in their build settings, returns 0.
01624 
01625     If some, but not all, child objects have the key in their build settings,
01626     or if any children have different values for the key, returns -1.
01627     """
01628 
01629     has = None
01630     value = None
01631     for configuration in self._properties['buildConfigurations']:
01632       configuration_has = configuration.HasBuildSetting(key)
01633       if has is None:
01634         has = configuration_has
01635       elif has != configuration_has:
01636         return -1
01637 
01638       if configuration_has:
01639         configuration_value = configuration.GetBuildSetting(key)
01640         if value is None:
01641           value = configuration_value
01642         elif value != configuration_value:
01643           return -1
01644 
01645     if not has:
01646       return 0
01647 
01648     return 1
01649 
01650   def GetBuildSetting(self, key):
01651     """Gets the build setting for key.
01652 
01653     All child XCConfiguration objects must have the same value set for the
01654     setting, or a ValueError will be raised.
01655     """
01656 
01657     # TODO(mark): This is wrong for build settings that are lists.  The list
01658     # contents should be compared (and a list copy returned?)
01659 
01660     value = None
01661     for configuration in self._properties['buildConfigurations']:
01662       configuration_value = configuration.GetBuildSetting(key)
01663       if value is None:
01664         value = configuration_value
01665       else:
01666         if value != configuration_value:
01667           raise ValueError('Variant values for ' + key)
01668 
01669     return value
01670 
01671   def SetBuildSetting(self, key, value):
01672     """Sets the build setting for key to value in all child
01673     XCBuildConfiguration objects.
01674     """
01675 
01676     for configuration in self._properties['buildConfigurations']:
01677       configuration.SetBuildSetting(key, value)
01678 
01679   def AppendBuildSetting(self, key, value):
01680     """Appends value to the build setting for key, which is treated as a list,
01681     in all child XCBuildConfiguration objects.
01682     """
01683 
01684     for configuration in self._properties['buildConfigurations']:
01685       configuration.AppendBuildSetting(key, value)
01686 
01687   def DelBuildSetting(self, key):
01688     """Deletes the build setting key from all child XCBuildConfiguration
01689     objects.
01690     """
01691 
01692     for configuration in self._properties['buildConfigurations']:
01693       configuration.DelBuildSetting(key)
01694 
01695   def SetBaseConfiguration(self, value):
01696     """Sets the build configuration in all child XCBuildConfiguration objects.
01697     """
01698 
01699     for configuration in self._properties['buildConfigurations']:
01700       configuration.SetBaseConfiguration(value)
01701 
01702 
01703 class PBXBuildFile(XCObject):
01704   _schema = XCObject._schema.copy()
01705   _schema.update({
01706     'fileRef':  [0, XCFileLikeElement, 0, 1],
01707     'settings': [0, str,               0, 0],  # hack, it's a dict
01708   })
01709 
01710   # Weird output rules for PBXBuildFile.
01711   _should_print_single_line = True
01712   _encode_transforms = XCObject._alternate_encode_transforms
01713 
01714   def Name(self):
01715     # Example: "main.cc in Sources"
01716     return self._properties['fileRef'].Name() + ' in ' + self.parent.Name()
01717 
01718   def Hashables(self):
01719     # super
01720     hashables = XCObject.Hashables(self)
01721 
01722     # It is not sufficient to just rely on Name() to get the
01723     # XCFileLikeElement's name, because that is not a complete pathname.
01724     # PathHashables returns hashables unique enough that no two
01725     # PBXBuildFiles should wind up with the same set of hashables, unless
01726     # someone adds the same file multiple times to the same target.  That
01727     # would be considered invalid anyway.
01728     hashables.extend(self._properties['fileRef'].PathHashables())
01729 
01730     return hashables
01731 
01732 
01733 class XCBuildPhase(XCObject):
01734   """Abstract base for build phase classes.  Not represented in a project
01735   file.
01736 
01737   Attributes:
01738     _files_by_path: A dict mapping each path of a child in the files list by
01739       path (keys) to the corresponding PBXBuildFile children (values).
01740     _files_by_xcfilelikeelement: A dict mapping each XCFileLikeElement (keys)
01741       to the corresponding PBXBuildFile children (values).
01742   """
01743 
01744   # TODO(mark): Some build phase types, like PBXShellScriptBuildPhase, don't
01745   # actually have a "files" list.  XCBuildPhase should not have "files" but
01746   # another abstract subclass of it should provide this, and concrete build
01747   # phase types that do have "files" lists should be derived from that new
01748   # abstract subclass.  XCBuildPhase should only provide buildActionMask and
01749   # runOnlyForDeploymentPostprocessing, and not files or the various
01750   # file-related methods and attributes.
01751 
01752   _schema = XCObject._schema.copy()
01753   _schema.update({
01754     'buildActionMask':                    [0, int,          0, 1, 0x7fffffff],
01755     'files':                              [1, PBXBuildFile, 1, 1, []],
01756     'runOnlyForDeploymentPostprocessing': [0, int,          0, 1, 0],
01757   })
01758 
01759   def __init__(self, properties=None, id=None, parent=None):
01760     # super
01761     XCObject.__init__(self, properties, id, parent)
01762 
01763     self._files_by_path = {}
01764     self._files_by_xcfilelikeelement = {}
01765     for pbxbuildfile in self._properties.get('files', []):
01766       self._AddBuildFileToDicts(pbxbuildfile)
01767 
01768   def FileGroup(self, path):
01769     # Subclasses must override this by returning a two-element tuple.  The
01770     # first item in the tuple should be the PBXGroup to which "path" should be
01771     # added, either as a child or deeper descendant.  The second item should
01772     # be a boolean indicating whether files should be added into hierarchical
01773     # groups or one single flat group.
01774     raise NotImplementedError(
01775           self.__class__.__name__ + ' must implement FileGroup')
01776 
01777   def _AddPathToDict(self, pbxbuildfile, path):
01778     """Adds path to the dict tracking paths belonging to this build phase.
01779 
01780     If the path is already a member of this build phase, raises an exception.
01781     """
01782 
01783     if path in self._files_by_path:
01784       raise ValueError('Found multiple build files with path ' + path)
01785     self._files_by_path[path] = pbxbuildfile
01786 
01787   def _AddBuildFileToDicts(self, pbxbuildfile, path=None):
01788     """Maintains the _files_by_path and _files_by_xcfilelikeelement dicts.
01789 
01790     If path is specified, then it is the path that is being added to the
01791     phase, and pbxbuildfile must contain either a PBXFileReference directly
01792     referencing that path, or it must contain a PBXVariantGroup that itself
01793     contains a PBXFileReference referencing the path.
01794 
01795     If path is not specified, either the PBXFileReference's path or the paths
01796     of all children of the PBXVariantGroup are taken as being added to the
01797     phase.
01798 
01799     If the path is already present in the phase, raises an exception.
01800 
01801     If the PBXFileReference or PBXVariantGroup referenced by pbxbuildfile
01802     are already present in the phase, referenced by a different PBXBuildFile
01803     object, raises an exception.  This does not raise an exception when
01804     a PBXFileReference or PBXVariantGroup reappear and are referenced by the
01805     same PBXBuildFile that has already introduced them, because in the case
01806     of PBXVariantGroup objects, they may correspond to multiple paths that are
01807     not all added simultaneously.  When this situation occurs, the path needs
01808     to be added to _files_by_path, but nothing needs to change in
01809     _files_by_xcfilelikeelement, and the caller should have avoided adding
01810     the PBXBuildFile if it is already present in the list of children.
01811     """
01812 
01813     xcfilelikeelement = pbxbuildfile._properties['fileRef']
01814 
01815     paths = []
01816     if path != None:
01817       # It's best when the caller provides the path.
01818       if isinstance(xcfilelikeelement, PBXVariantGroup):
01819         paths.append(path)
01820     else:
01821       # If the caller didn't provide a path, there can be either multiple
01822       # paths (PBXVariantGroup) or one.
01823       if isinstance(xcfilelikeelement, PBXVariantGroup):
01824         for variant in xcfilelikeelement._properties['children']:
01825           paths.append(variant.FullPath())
01826       else:
01827         paths.append(xcfilelikeelement.FullPath())
01828 
01829     # Add the paths first, because if something's going to raise, the
01830     # messages provided by _AddPathToDict are more useful owing to its
01831     # having access to a real pathname and not just an object's Name().
01832     for a_path in paths:
01833       self._AddPathToDict(pbxbuildfile, a_path)
01834 
01835     # If another PBXBuildFile references this XCFileLikeElement, there's a
01836     # problem.
01837     if xcfilelikeelement in self._files_by_xcfilelikeelement and \
01838        self._files_by_xcfilelikeelement[xcfilelikeelement] != pbxbuildfile:
01839       raise ValueError('Found multiple build files for ' + \
01840                        xcfilelikeelement.Name())
01841     self._files_by_xcfilelikeelement[xcfilelikeelement] = pbxbuildfile
01842 
01843   def AppendBuildFile(self, pbxbuildfile, path=None):
01844     # Callers should use this instead of calling
01845     # AppendProperty('files', pbxbuildfile) directly because this function
01846     # maintains the object's dicts.  Better yet, callers can just call AddFile
01847     # with a pathname and not worry about building their own PBXBuildFile
01848     # objects.
01849     self.AppendProperty('files', pbxbuildfile)
01850     self._AddBuildFileToDicts(pbxbuildfile, path)
01851 
01852   def AddFile(self, path, settings=None):
01853     (file_group, hierarchical) = self.FileGroup(path)
01854     file_ref = file_group.AddOrGetFileByPath(path, hierarchical)
01855 
01856     if file_ref in self._files_by_xcfilelikeelement and \
01857        isinstance(file_ref, PBXVariantGroup):
01858       # There's already a PBXBuildFile in this phase corresponding to the
01859       # PBXVariantGroup.  path just provides a new variant that belongs to
01860       # the group.  Add the path to the dict.
01861       pbxbuildfile = self._files_by_xcfilelikeelement[file_ref]
01862       self._AddBuildFileToDicts(pbxbuildfile, path)
01863     else:
01864       # Add a new PBXBuildFile to get file_ref into the phase.
01865       if settings is None:
01866         pbxbuildfile = PBXBuildFile({'fileRef': file_ref})
01867       else:
01868         pbxbuildfile = PBXBuildFile({'fileRef': file_ref, 'settings': settings})
01869       self.AppendBuildFile(pbxbuildfile, path)
01870 
01871

01901 
01902 class PBXFrameworksBuildPhase(XCBuildPhase):
01903   # No additions to the schema relative to XCBuildPhase.
01904 
01905   def Name(self):
01906     return 'Frameworks'
01907 
01908   def FileGroup(self, path):
01909     (root, ext) = posixpath.splitext(path)
01910     if ext != '':
01911       ext = ext[1:].lower()
01912     if ext == 'o':
01913       # .o files are added to Xcode Frameworks phases, but conceptually aren't
01914       # frameworks, they're more like sources or intermediates. Redirect them
01915       # to show up in one of those other groups.
01916       return self.PBXProjectAncestor().RootGroupForPath(path)
01917     else:
01918       return (self.PBXProjectAncestor().FrameworksGroup(), False)
01919

01921 class PBXShellScriptBuildPhase(XCBuildPhase):
01922   _schema = XCBuildPhase._schema.copy()
01923   _schema.update({
01924     'inputPaths':       [1, str, 0, 1, []],
01925     'name':             [0, str, 0, 0],
01926     'outputPaths':      [1, str, 0, 1, []],
01927     'shellPath':        [0, str, 0, 1, '/bin/sh'],
01928     'shellScript':      [0, str, 0, 1],
01929     'showEnvVarsInLog': [0, int, 0, 0],
01930   })
01931 
01932   def Name(self):
01933     if 'name' in self._properties:
01934       return self._properties['name']
01935 
01936     return 'ShellScript'

01938 
01939 class PBXCopyFilesBuildPhase(XCBuildPhase):
01940   _schema = XCBuildPhase._schema.copy()
01941   _schema.update({
01942     'dstPath':          [0, str, 0, 1],
01943     'dstSubfolderSpec': [0, int, 0, 1],
01944     'name':             [0, str, 0, 0],
01945   })
01946 
01947   # path_tree_re matches "$(DIR)/path" or just "$(DIR)".  Match group 1 is
01948   # "DIR", match group 3 is "path" or None.
01949   path_tree_re = re.compile('^\\$\\((.*)\\)(/(.*)|)$')
01950 
01951   # path_tree_to_subfolder maps names of Xcode variables to the associated
01952   # dstSubfolderSpec property value used in a PBXCopyFilesBuildPhase object.
01953   path_tree_to_subfolder = {
01954     'BUILT_PRODUCTS_DIR': 16,  # Products Directory
01955     # Other types that can be chosen via the Xcode UI.
01956     # TODO(mark): Map Xcode variable names to these.
01957     # : 1,  # Wrapper
01958     # : 6,  # Executables: 6
01959     # : 7,  # Resources
01960     # : 15,  # Java Resources
01961     # : 10,  # Frameworks
01962     # : 11,  # Shared Frameworks
01963     # : 12,  # Shared Support
01964     # : 13,  # PlugIns
01965   }
01966 
01967   def Name(self):
01968     if 'name' in self._properties:
01969       return self._properties['name']
01970 
01971     return 'CopyFiles'
01972 
01973   def FileGroup(self, path):
01974     return self.PBXProjectAncestor().RootGroupForPath(path)
01975 
01976   def SetDestination(self, path):
01977     """Set the dstSubfolderSpec and dstPath properties from path.
01978 
01979     path may be specified in the same notation used for XCHierarchicalElements,
01980     specifically, "$(DIR)/path".
01981     """
01982 
01983     path_tree_match = self.path_tree_re.search(path)
01984     if path_tree_match:
01985       # Everything else needs to be relative to an Xcode variable.
01986       path_tree = path_tree_match.group(1)
01987       relative_path = path_tree_match.group(3)
01988 
01989       if path_tree in self.path_tree_to_subfolder:
01990         subfolder = self.path_tree_to_subfolder[path_tree]
01991         if relative_path is None:
01992           relative_path = ''
01993       else:
01994         # The path starts with an unrecognized Xcode variable
01995         # name like $(SRCROOT).  Xcode will still handle this
01996         # as an "absolute path" that starts with the variable.
01997         subfolder = 0
01998         relative_path = path
01999     elif path.startswith('/'):
02000       # Special case.  Absolute paths are in dstSubfolderSpec 0.
02001       subfolder = 0
02002       relative_path = path[1:]
02003     else:
02004       raise ValueError('Can\'t use path %s in a %s' % \
02005                        (path, self.__class__.__name__))
02006 
02007     self._properties['dstPath'] = relative_path
02008     self._properties['dstSubfolderSpec'] = subfolder
02009 
02010 
02011 class PBXBuildRule(XCObject):
02012   _schema = XCObject._schema.copy()
02013   _schema.update({
02014     'compilerSpec': [0, str, 0, 1],
02015     'filePatterns': [0, str, 0, 0],
02016     'fileType':     [0, str, 0, 1],
02017     'isEditable':   [0, int, 0, 1, 1],
02018     'outputFiles':  [1, str, 0, 1, []],
02019     'script':       [0, str, 0, 0],
02020   })
02021 
02022   def Name(self):
02023     # Not very inspired, but it's what Xcode uses.
02024     return self.__class__.__name__
02025 
02026   def Hashables(self):
02027     # super
02028     hashables = XCObject.Hashables(self)
02029 
02030     # Use the hashables of the weak objects that this object refers to.
02031     hashables.append(self._properties['fileType'])
02032     if 'filePatterns' in self._properties:
02033       hashables.append(self._properties['filePatterns'])
02034     return hashables
02035 
02036 
02037 class PBXContainerItemProxy(XCObject):
02038   # When referencing an item in this project file, containerPortal is the
02039   # PBXProject root object of this project file.  When referencing an item in
02040   # another project file, containerPortal is a PBXFileReference identifying
02041   # the other project file.
02042   #
02043   # When serving as a proxy to an XCTarget (in this project file or another),
02044   # proxyType is 1.  When serving as a proxy to a PBXFileReference (in another
02045   # project file), proxyType is 2.  Type 2 is used for references to the
02046   # producs of the other project file's targets.
02047   #
02048   # Xcode is weird about remoteGlobalIDString.  Usually, it's printed without
02049   # a comment, indicating that it's tracked internally simply as a string, but
02050   # sometimes it's printed with a comment (usually when the object is initially
02051   # created), indicating that it's tracked as a project file object at least
02052   # sometimes.  This module always tracks it as an object, but contains a hack
02053   # to prevent it from printing the comment in the project file output.  See
02054   # _XCKVPrint.
02055   _schema = XCObject._schema.copy()
02056   _schema.update({
02057     'containerPortal':      [0, XCContainerPortal, 0, 1],
02058     'proxyType':            [0, int,               0, 1],
02059     'remoteGlobalIDString': [0, XCRemoteObject,    0, 1],
02060     'remoteInfo':           [0, str,               0, 1],
02061   })
02062 
02063   def __repr__(self):
02064     props = self._properties
02065     name = '%s.gyp:%s' % (props['containerPortal'].Name(), props['remoteInfo'])
02066     return '<%s %r at 0x%x>' % (self.__class__.__name__, name, id(self))
02067 
02068   def Name(self):
02069     # Admittedly not the best name, but it's what Xcode uses.
02070     return self.__class__.__name__
02071 
02072   def Hashables(self):
02073     # super
02074     hashables = XCObject.Hashables(self)
02075 
02076     # Use the hashables of the weak objects that this object refers to.
02077     hashables.extend(self._properties['containerPortal'].Hashables())
02078     hashables.extend(self._properties['remoteGlobalIDString'].Hashables())
02079     return hashables
02080 
02081 
02082 class PBXTargetDependency(XCObject):
02083   # The "target" property accepts an XCTarget object, and obviously not
02084   # NoneType.  But XCTarget is defined below, so it can't be put into the
02085   # schema yet.  The definition of PBXTargetDependency can't be moved below
02086   # XCTarget because XCTarget's own schema references PBXTargetDependency.
02087   # Python doesn't deal well with this circular relationship, and doesn't have
02088   # a real way to do forward declarations.  To work around, the type of
02089   # the "target" property is reset below, after XCTarget is defined.
02090   #
02091   # At least one of "name" and "target" is required.
02092   _schema = XCObject._schema.copy()
02093   _schema.update({
02094     'name':        [0, str,                   0, 0],
02095     'target':      [0, None.__class__,        0, 0],
02096     'targetProxy': [0, PBXContainerItemProxy, 1, 1],
02097   })
02098 
02099   def __repr__(self):
02100     name = self._properties.get('name') or self._properties['target'].Name()
02101     return '<%s %r at 0x%x>' % (self.__class__.__name__, name, id(self))
02102 
02103   def Name(self):
02104     # Admittedly not the best name, but it's what Xcode uses.
02105     return self.__class__.__name__
02106 
02107   def Hashables(self):
02108     # super
02109     hashables = XCObject.Hashables(self)
02110 
02111     # Use the hashables of the weak objects that this object refers to.
02112     hashables.extend(self._properties['targetProxy'].Hashables())
02113     return hashables
02114 
02115 
02116 class PBXReferenceProxy(XCFileLikeElement):
02117   _schema = XCFileLikeElement._schema.copy()
02118   _schema.update({
02119     'fileType':  [0, str,                   0, 1],
02120     'path':      [0, str,                   0, 1],
02121     'remoteRef': [0, PBXContainerItemProxy, 1, 1],
02122   })
02123 
02124 
02125 class XCTarget(XCRemoteObject):
02126   # An XCTarget is really just an XCObject, the XCRemoteObject thing is just
02127   # to allow PBXProject to be used in the remoteGlobalIDString property of
02128   # PBXContainerItemProxy.
02129   #
02130   # Setting a "name" property at instantiation may also affect "productName",
02131   # which may in turn affect the "PRODUCT_NAME" build setting in children of
02132   # "buildConfigurationList".  See __init__ below.
02133   _schema = XCRemoteObject._schema.copy()
02134   _schema.update({
02135     'buildConfigurationList': [0, XCConfigurationList, 1, 1,
02136                                XCConfigurationList()],
02137     'buildPhases':            [1, XCBuildPhase,        1, 1, []],
02138     'dependencies':           [1, PBXTargetDependency, 1, 1, []],
02139     'name':                   [0, str,                 0, 1],
02140     'productName':            [0, str,                 0, 1],
02141   })
02142 
02143   def __init__(self, properties=None, id=None, parent=None,
02144                force_outdir=None, force_prefix=None, force_extension=None):
02145     # super
02146     XCRemoteObject.__init__(self, properties, id, parent)
02147 
02148     # Set up additional defaults not expressed in the schema.  If a "name"
02149     # property was supplied, set "productName" if it is not present.  Also set
02150     # the "PRODUCT_NAME" build setting in each configuration, but only if
02151     # the setting is not present in any build configuration.
02152     if 'name' in self._properties:
02153       if not 'productName' in self._properties:
02154         self.SetProperty('productName', self._properties['name'])
02155 
02156     if 'productName' in self._properties:
02157       if 'buildConfigurationList' in self._properties:
02158         configs = self._properties['buildConfigurationList']
02159         if configs.HasBuildSetting('PRODUCT_NAME') == 0:
02160           configs.SetBuildSetting('PRODUCT_NAME',
02161                                   self._properties['productName'])
02162 
02163   def AddDependency(self, other):
02164     pbxproject = self.PBXProjectAncestor()
02165     other_pbxproject = other.PBXProjectAncestor()
02166     if pbxproject == other_pbxproject:
02167       # Add a dependency to another target in the same project file.
02168       container = PBXContainerItemProxy({'containerPortal':      pbxproject,
02169                                          'proxyType':            1,
02170                                          'remoteGlobalIDString': other,
02171                                          'remoteInfo':           other.Name()})
02172       dependency = PBXTargetDependency({'target':      other,
02173                                         'targetProxy': container})
02174       self.AppendProperty('dependencies', dependency)
02175     else:
02176       # Add a dependency to a target in a different project file.
02177       other_project_ref = \
02178           pbxproject.AddOrGetProjectReference(other_pbxproject)[1]
02179       container = PBXContainerItemProxy({
02180             'containerPortal':      other_project_ref,
02181             'proxyType':            1,
02182             'remoteGlobalIDString': other,
02183             'remoteInfo':           other.Name(),
02184           })
02185       dependency = PBXTargetDependency({'name':        other.Name(),
02186                                         'targetProxy': container})
02187       self.AppendProperty('dependencies', dependency)
02188 
02189   # Proxy all of these through to the build configuration list.
02190 
02191   def ConfigurationNamed(self, name):
02192     return self._properties['buildConfigurationList'].ConfigurationNamed(name)
02193 
02194   def DefaultConfiguration(self):
02195     return self._properties['buildConfigurationList'].DefaultConfiguration()
02196 
02197   def HasBuildSetting(self, key):
02198     return self._properties['buildConfigurationList'].HasBuildSetting(key)
02199 
02200   def GetBuildSetting(self, key):
02201     return self._properties['buildConfigurationList'].GetBuildSetting(key)
02202 
02203   def SetBuildSetting(self, key, value):
02204     return self._properties['buildConfigurationList'].SetBuildSetting(key, \
02205                                                                       value)
02206 
02207   def AppendBuildSetting(self, key, value):
02208     return self._properties['buildConfigurationList'].AppendBuildSetting(key, \
02209                                                                          value)
02210 
02211   def DelBuildSetting(self, key):
02212     return self._properties['buildConfigurationList'].DelBuildSetting(key)
02213 
02214 
02215 # Redefine the type of the "target" property.  See PBXTargetDependency._schema
02216 # above.
02217 PBXTargetDependency._schema['target'][1] = XCTarget
02218 
02219 
02220 class PBXNativeTarget(XCTarget):
02221   # buildPhases is overridden in the schema to be able to set defaults.
02222   #
02223   # NOTE: Contrary to most objects, it is advisable to set parent when
02224   # constructing PBXNativeTarget.  A parent of an XCTarget must be a PBXProject
02225   # object.  A parent reference is required for a PBXNativeTarget during
02226   # construction to be able to set up the target defaults for productReference,
02227   # because a PBXBuildFile object must be created for the target and it must
02228   # be added to the PBXProject's mainGroup hierarchy.
02229   _schema = XCTarget._schema.copy()
02230   _schema.update({
02231     'buildPhases':      [1, XCBuildPhase,     1, 1,
02232                          [PBXSourcesBuildPhase(), PBXFrameworksBuildPhase()]],
02233     'buildRules':       [1, PBXBuildRule,     1, 1, []],
02234     'productReference': [0, PBXFileReference, 0, 1],
02235     'productType':      [0, str,              0, 1],
02236   })
02237 
02238   # Mapping from Xcode product-types to settings.  The settings are:
02239   #  filetype : used for explicitFileType in the project file
02240   #  prefix : the prefix for the file name
02241   #  suffix : the suffix for the file name
02242   _product_filetypes = {
02243     'com.apple.product-type.application':           ['wrapper.application',
02244                                                      '', '.app'],
02245     'com.apple.product-type.application.watchapp':  ['wrapper.application',
02246                                                      '', '.app'],
02247     'com.apple.product-type.watchkit-extension':    ['wrapper.app-extension',
02248                                                      '', '.appex'],
02249     'com.apple.product-type.app-extension':         ['wrapper.app-extension',
02250                                                      '', '.appex'],
02251     'com.apple.product-type.bundle':            ['wrapper.cfbundle',
02252                                                  '', '.bundle'],
02253     'com.apple.product-type.framework':         ['wrapper.framework',
02254                                                  '', '.framework'],
02255     'com.apple.product-type.library.dynamic':   ['compiled.mach-o.dylib',
02256                                                  'lib', '.dylib'],
02257     'com.apple.product-type.library.static':    ['archive.ar',
02258                                                  'lib', '.a'],
02259     'com.apple.product-type.tool':              ['compiled.mach-o.executable',
02260                                                  '', ''],
02261     'com.apple.product-type.bundle.unit-test':  ['wrapper.cfbundle',
02262                                                  '', '.xctest'],
02263     'com.googlecode.gyp.xcode.bundle':          ['compiled.mach-o.dylib',
02264                                                  '', '.so'],
02265   }
02266 
02267   def __init__(self, properties=None, id=None, parent=None,
02268                force_outdir=None, force_prefix=None, force_extension=None):
02269     # super
02270     XCTarget.__init__(self, properties, id, parent)
02271 
02272     if 'productName' in self._properties and \
02273        'productType' in self._properties and \
02274        not 'productReference' in self._properties and \
02275        self._properties['productType'] in self._product_filetypes:
02276       products_group = None
02277       pbxproject = self.PBXProjectAncestor()
02278       if pbxproject != None:
02279         products_group = pbxproject.ProductsGroup()
02280 
02281       if products_group != None:
02282         (filetype, prefix, suffix) = \
02283             self._product_filetypes[self._properties['productType']]
02284         # Xcode does not have a distinct type for loadable modules that are
02285         # pure BSD targets (not in a bundle wrapper). GYP allows such modules
02286         # to be specified by setting a target type to loadable_module without
02287         # having mac_bundle set. These are mapped to the pseudo-product type
02288         # com.googlecode.gyp.xcode.bundle.
02289         #
02290         # By picking up this special type and converting it to a dynamic
02291         # library (com.apple.product-type.library.dynamic) with fix-ups,
02292         # single-file loadable modules can be produced.
02293         #
02294         # MACH_O_TYPE is changed to mh_bundle to produce the proper file type
02295         # (as opposed to mh_dylib). In order for linking to succeed,
02296         # DYLIB_CURRENT_VERSION and DYLIB_COMPATIBILITY_VERSION must be
02297         # cleared. They are meaningless for type mh_bundle.
02298         #
02299         # Finally, the .so extension is forcibly applied over the default
02300         # (.dylib), unless another forced extension is already selected.
02301         # .dylib is plainly wrong, and .bundle is used by loadable_modules in
02302         # bundle wrappers (com.apple.product-type.bundle). .so seems an odd
02303         # choice because it's used as the extension on many other systems that
02304         # don't distinguish between linkable shared libraries and non-linkable
02305         # loadable modules, but there's precedent: Python loadable modules on
02306         # Mac OS X use an .so extension.
02307         if self._properties['productType'] == 'com.googlecode.gyp.xcode.bundle':
02308           self._properties['productType'] = \
02309               'com.apple.product-type.library.dynamic'
02310           self.SetBuildSetting('MACH_O_TYPE', 'mh_bundle')
02311           self.SetBuildSetting('DYLIB_CURRENT_VERSION', '')
02312           self.SetBuildSetting('DYLIB_COMPATIBILITY_VERSION', '')
02313           if force_extension is None:
02314             force_extension = suffix[1:]
02315 
02316         if self._properties['productType'] == \
02317            'com.apple.product-type-bundle.unit.test':
02318           if force_extension is None:
02319             force_extension = suffix[1:]
02320 
02321         if force_extension is not None:
02322           # If it's a wrapper (bundle), set WRAPPER_EXTENSION.
02323           # Extension override.
02324           suffix = '.' + force_extension
02325           if filetype.startswith('wrapper.'):
02326             self.SetBuildSetting('WRAPPER_EXTENSION', force_extension)
02327           else:
02328             self.SetBuildSetting('EXECUTABLE_EXTENSION', force_extension)
02329 
02330           if filetype.startswith('compiled.mach-o.executable'):
02331             product_name = self._properties['productName']
02332             product_name += suffix
02333             suffix = ''
02334             self.SetProperty('productName', product_name)
02335             self.SetBuildSetting('PRODUCT_NAME', product_name)
02336 
02337         # Xcode handles most prefixes based on the target type, however there
02338         # are exceptions.  If a "BSD Dynamic Library" target is added in the
02339         # Xcode UI, Xcode sets EXECUTABLE_PREFIX.  This check duplicates that
02340         # behavior.
02341         if force_prefix is not None:
02342           prefix = force_prefix
02343         if filetype.startswith('wrapper.'):
02344           self.SetBuildSetting('WRAPPER_PREFIX', prefix)
02345         else:
02346           self.SetBuildSetting('EXECUTABLE_PREFIX', prefix)
02347 
02348         if force_outdir is not None:
02349           self.SetBuildSetting('TARGET_BUILD_DIR', force_outdir)
02350 
02351         # TODO(tvl): Remove the below hack.
02352         #    http://code.google.com/p/gyp/issues/detail?id=122
02353 
02354         # Some targets include the prefix in the target_name.  These targets
02355         # really should just add a product_name setting that doesn't include
02356         # the prefix.  For example:
02357         #  target_name = 'libevent', product_name = 'event'
02358         # This check cleans up for them.
02359         product_name = self._properties['productName']
02360         prefix_len = len(prefix)
02361         if prefix_len and (product_name[:prefix_len] == prefix):
02362           product_name = product_name[prefix_len:]
02363           self.SetProperty('productName', product_name)
02364           self.SetBuildSetting('PRODUCT_NAME', product_name)
02365 
02366         ref_props = {
02367           'explicitFileType': filetype,
02368           'includeInIndex':   0,
02369           'path':             prefix + product_name + suffix,
02370           'sourceTree':       'BUILT_PRODUCTS_DIR',
02371         }
02372         file_ref = PBXFileReference(ref_props)
02373         products_group.AppendChild(file_ref)
02374         self.SetProperty('productReference', file_ref)
02375 
02376   def GetBuildPhaseByType(self, type):
02377     if not 'buildPhases' in self._properties:
02378       return None
02379 
02380     the_phase = None
02381     for phase in self._properties['buildPhases']:
02382       if isinstance(phase, type):
02383         # Some phases may be present in multiples in a well-formed project file,
02384         # but phases like PBXSourcesBuildPhase may only be present singly, and
02385         # this function is intended as an aid to GetBuildPhaseByType.  Loop
02386         # over the entire list of phases and assert if more than one of the
02387         # desired type is found.
02388         assert the_phase is None
02389         the_phase = phase
02390 
02391     return the_phase
02392 
02393   def HeadersPhase(self):
02394     headers_phase = self.GetBuildPhaseByType(PBXHeadersBuildPhase)
02395     if headers_phase is None:
02396       headers_phase = PBXHeadersBuildPhase()
02397 
02398       # The headers phase should come before the resources, sources, and
02399       # frameworks phases, if any.
02400       insert_at = len(self._properties['buildPhases'])
02401       for index in xrange(0, len(self._properties['buildPhases'])):
02402         phase = self._properties['buildPhases'][index]
02403         if isinstance(phase, PBXResourcesBuildPhase) or \
02404            isinstance(phase, PBXSourcesBuildPhase) or \
02405            isinstance(phase, PBXFrameworksBuildPhase):
02406           insert_at = index
02407           break
02408 
02409       self._properties['buildPhases'].insert(insert_at, headers_phase)
02410       headers_phase.parent = self
02411 
02412     return headers_phase
02413 
02414   def ResourcesPhase(self):
02415     resources_phase = self.GetBuildPhaseByType(PBXResourcesBuildPhase)
02416     if resources_phase is None:
02417       resources_phase = PBXResourcesBuildPhase()
02418 
02419       # The resources phase should come before the sources and frameworks
02420       # phases, if any.
02421       insert_at = len(self._properties['buildPhases'])
02422       for index in xrange(0, len(self._properties['buildPhases'])):
02423         phase = self._properties['buildPhases'][index]
02424         if isinstance(phase, PBXSourcesBuildPhase) or \
02425            isinstance(phase, PBXFrameworksBuildPhase):
02426           insert_at = index
02427           break
02428 
02429       self._properties['buildPhases'].insert(insert_at, resources_phase)
02430       resources_phase.parent = self
02431 
02432     return resources_phase
02433 
02434   def SourcesPhase(self):
02435     sources_phase = self.GetBuildPhaseByType(PBXSourcesBuildPhase)
02436     if sources_phase is None:
02437       sources_phase = PBXSourcesBuildPhase()
02438       self.AppendProperty('buildPhases', sources_phase)
02439 
02440     return sources_phase
02441 
02442   def FrameworksPhase(self):
02443     frameworks_phase = self.GetBuildPhaseByType(PBXFrameworksBuildPhase)
02444     if frameworks_phase is None:
02445       frameworks_phase = PBXFrameworksBuildPhase()
02446       self.AppendProperty('buildPhases', frameworks_phase)
02447 
02448     return frameworks_phase
02449 
02450   def AddDependency(self, other):
02451     # super
02452     XCTarget.AddDependency(self, other)
02453 
02454     static_library_type = 'com.apple.product-type.library.static'
02455     shared_library_type = 'com.apple.product-type.library.dynamic'
02456     framework_type = 'com.apple.product-type.framework'
02457     if isinstance(other, PBXNativeTarget) and \
02458        'productType' in self._properties and \
02459        self._properties['productType'] != static_library_type and \
02460        'productType' in other._properties and \
02461        (other._properties['productType'] == static_library_type or \
02462         ((other._properties['productType'] == shared_library_type or \
02463           other._properties['productType'] == framework_type) and \
02464          ((not other.HasBuildSetting('MACH_O_TYPE')) or
02465           other.GetBuildSetting('MACH_O_TYPE') != 'mh_bundle'))):
02466 
02467       file_ref = other.GetProperty('productReference')
02468 
02469       pbxproject = self.PBXProjectAncestor()
02470       other_pbxproject = other.PBXProjectAncestor()
02471       if pbxproject != other_pbxproject:
02472         other_project_product_group = \
02473             pbxproject.AddOrGetProjectReference(other_pbxproject)[0]
02474         file_ref = other_project_product_group.GetChildByRemoteObject(file_ref)
02475 
02476       self.FrameworksPhase().AppendProperty('files',
02477                                             PBXBuildFile({'fileRef': file_ref}))
02478 
02479 
02480 class PBXAggregateTarget(XCTarget):
02481   pass
02482 
02483 
02484 class PBXProject(XCContainerPortal):
02485   # A PBXProject is really just an XCObject, the XCContainerPortal thing is
02486   # just to allow PBXProject to be used in the containerPortal property of
02487   # PBXContainerItemProxy.
02488   """
02489 
02490   Attributes:
02491     path: "sample.xcodeproj".  TODO(mark) Document me!
02492     _other_pbxprojects: A dictionary, keyed by other PBXProject objects.  Each
02493                         value is a reference to the dict in the
02494                         projectReferences list associated with the keyed
02495                         PBXProject.
02496   """
02497 
02498   _schema = XCContainerPortal._schema.copy()
02499   _schema.update({
02500     'attributes':             [0, dict,                0, 0],
02501     'buildConfigurationList': [0, XCConfigurationList, 1, 1,
02502                                XCConfigurationList()],
02503     'compatibilityVersion':   [0, str,                 0, 1, 'Xcode 3.2'],
02504     'hasScannedForEncodings': [0, int,                 0, 1, 1],
02505     'mainGroup':              [0, PBXGroup,            1, 1, PBXGroup()],
02506     'projectDirPath':         [0, str,                 0, 1, ''],
02507     'projectReferences':      [1, dict,                0, 0],
02508     'projectRoot':            [0, str,                 0, 1, ''],
02509     'targets':                [1, XCTarget,            1, 1, []],
02510   })
02511 
02512   def __init__(self, properties=None, id=None, parent=None, path=None):
02513     self.path = path
02514     self._other_pbxprojects = {}
02515     # super
02516     return XCContainerPortal.__init__(self, properties, id, parent)
02517 
02518   def Name(self):
02519     name = self.path
02520     if name[-10:] == '.xcodeproj':
02521       name = name[:-10]
02522     return posixpath.basename(name)
02523 
02524   def Path(self):
02525     return self.path
02526 
02527   def Comment(self):
02528     return 'Project object'
02529 
02530   def Children(self):
02531     # super
02532     children = XCContainerPortal.Children(self)
02533 
02534     # Add children that the schema doesn't know about.  Maybe there's a more
02535     # elegant way around this, but this is the only case where we need to own
02536     # objects in a dictionary (that is itself in a list), and three lines for
02537     # a one-off isn't that big a deal.
02538     if 'projectReferences' in self._properties:
02539       for reference in self._properties['projectReferences']:
02540         children.append(reference['ProductGroup'])
02541 
02542     return children
02543 
02544   def PBXProjectAncestor(self):
02545     return self
02546 
02547   def _GroupByName(self, name):
02548     if not 'mainGroup' in self._properties:
02549       self.SetProperty('mainGroup', PBXGroup())
02550 
02551     main_group = self._properties['mainGroup']
02552     group = main_group.GetChildByName(name)
02553     if group is None:
02554       group = PBXGroup({'name': name})
02555       main_group.AppendChild(group)
02556 
02557     return group
02558 
02559   # SourceGroup and ProductsGroup are created by default in Xcode's own
02560   # templates.
02561   def SourceGroup(self):
02562     return self._GroupByName('Source')
02563 
02564   def ProductsGroup(self):
02565     return self._GroupByName('Products')
02566 
02567   # IntermediatesGroup is used to collect source-like files that are generated
02568   # by rules or script phases and are placed in intermediate directories such
02569   # as DerivedSources.
02570   def IntermediatesGroup(self):
02571     return self._GroupByName('Intermediates')
02572 
02573   # FrameworksGroup and ProjectsGroup are top-level groups used to collect
02574   # frameworks and projects.
02575   def FrameworksGroup(self):
02576     return self._GroupByName('Frameworks')
02577 
02578   def ProjectsGroup(self):
02579     return self._GroupByName('Projects')
02580 
02581   def RootGroupForPath(self, path):
02582     """Returns a PBXGroup child of this object to which path should be added.
02583 
02584     This method is intended to choose between SourceGroup and
02585     IntermediatesGroup on the basis of whether path is present in a source
02586     directory or an intermediates directory.  For the purposes of this
02587     determination, any path located within a derived file directory such as
02588     PROJECT_DERIVED_FILE_DIR is treated as being in an intermediates
02589     directory.
02590 
02591     The returned value is a two-element tuple.  The first element is the
02592     PBXGroup, and the second element specifies whether that group should be
02593     organized hierarchically (True) or as a single flat list (False).
02594     """
02595 
02596     # TODO(mark): make this a class variable and bind to self on call?
02597     # Also, this list is nowhere near exhaustive.
02598     # INTERMEDIATE_DIR and SHARED_INTERMEDIATE_DIR are used by
02599     # gyp.generator.xcode.  There should probably be some way for that module
02600     # to push the names in, rather than having to hard-code them here.
02601     source_tree_groups = {
02602       'DERIVED_FILE_DIR':         (self.IntermediatesGroup, True),
02603       'INTERMEDIATE_DIR':         (self.IntermediatesGroup, True),
02604       'PROJECT_DERIVED_FILE_DIR': (self.IntermediatesGroup, True),
02605       'SHARED_INTERMEDIATE_DIR':  (self.IntermediatesGroup, True),
02606     }
02607 
02608     (source_tree, path) = SourceTreeAndPathFromPath(path)
02609     if source_tree != None and source_tree in source_tree_groups:
02610       (group_func, hierarchical) = source_tree_groups[source_tree]
02611       group = group_func()
02612       return (group, hierarchical)
02613 
02614     # TODO(mark): make additional choices based on file extension.
02615 
02616     return (self.SourceGroup(), True)
02617 
02618   def AddOrGetFileInRootGroup(self, path):
02619     """Returns a PBXFileReference corresponding to path in the correct group
02620     according to RootGroupForPath's heuristics.
02621 
02622     If an existing PBXFileReference for path exists, it will be returned.
02623     Otherwise, one will be created and returned.
02624     """
02625 
02626     (group, hierarchical) = self.RootGroupForPath(path)
02627     return group.AddOrGetFileByPath(path, hierarchical)
02628 
02629   def RootGroupsTakeOverOnlyChildren(self, recurse=False):
02630     """Calls TakeOverOnlyChild for all groups in the main group."""
02631 
02632     for group in self._properties['mainGroup']._properties['children']:
02633       if isinstance(group, PBXGroup):
02634         group.TakeOverOnlyChild(recurse)
02635 
02636   def SortGroups(self):
02637     # Sort the children of the mainGroup (like "Source" and "Products")
02638     # according to their defined order.
02639     self._properties['mainGroup']._properties['children'] = \
02640         sorted(self._properties['mainGroup']._properties['children'],
02641                cmp=lambda x,y: x.CompareRootGroup(y))
02642 
02643     # Sort everything else by putting group before files, and going
02644     # alphabetically by name within sections of groups and files.  SortGroup
02645     # is recursive.
02646     for group in self._properties['mainGroup']._properties['children']:
02647       if not isinstance(group, PBXGroup):
02648         continue
02649 
02650       if group.Name() == 'Products':
02651         # The Products group is a special case.  Instead of sorting
02652         # alphabetically, sort things in the order of the targets that
02653         # produce the products.  To do this, just build up a new list of
02654         # products based on the targets.
02655         products = []
02656         for target in self._properties['targets']:
02657           if not isinstance(target, PBXNativeTarget):
02658             continue
02659           product = target._properties['productReference']
02660           # Make sure that the product is already in the products group.
02661           assert product in group._properties['children']
02662           products.append(product)
02663 
02664         # Make sure that this process doesn't miss anything that was already
02665         # in the products group.
02666         assert len(products) == len(group._properties['children'])
02667         group._properties['children'] = products
02668       else:
02669         group.SortGroup()
02670 
02671   def AddOrGetProjectReference(self, other_pbxproject):
02672     """Add a reference to another project file (via PBXProject object) to this
02673     one.
02674 
02675     Returns [ProductGroup, ProjectRef].  ProductGroup is a PBXGroup object in
02676     this project file that contains a PBXReferenceProxy object for each
02677     product of each PBXNativeTarget in the other project file.  ProjectRef is
02678     a PBXFileReference to the other project file.
02679 
02680     If this project file already references the other project file, the
02681     existing ProductGroup and ProjectRef are returned.  The ProductGroup will
02682     still be updated if necessary.
02683     """
02684 
02685     if not 'projectReferences' in self._properties:
02686       self._properties['projectReferences'] = []
02687 
02688     product_group = None
02689     project_ref = None
02690 
02691     if not other_pbxproject in self._other_pbxprojects:
02692       # This project file isn't yet linked to the other one.  Establish the
02693       # link.
02694       product_group = PBXGroup({'name': 'Products'})
02695 
02696       # ProductGroup is strong.
02697       product_group.parent = self
02698 
02699       # There's nothing unique about this PBXGroup, and if left alone, it will
02700       # wind up with the same set of hashables as all other PBXGroup objects
02701       # owned by the projectReferences list.  Add the hashables of the
02702       # remote PBXProject that it's related to.
02703       product_group._hashables.extend(other_pbxproject.Hashables())
02704 
02705       # The other project reports its path as relative to the same directory
02706       # that this project's path is relative to.  The other project's path
02707       # is not necessarily already relative to this project.  Figure out the
02708       # pathname that this project needs to use to refer to the other one.
02709       this_path = posixpath.dirname(self.Path())
02710       projectDirPath = self.GetProperty('projectDirPath')
02711       if projectDirPath:
02712         if posixpath.isabs(projectDirPath[0]):
02713           this_path = projectDirPath
02714         else:
02715           this_path = posixpath.join(this_path, projectDirPath)
02716       other_path = gyp.common.RelativePath(other_pbxproject.Path(), this_path)
02717 
02718       # ProjectRef is weak (it's owned by the mainGroup hierarchy).
02719       project_ref = PBXFileReference({
02720             'lastKnownFileType': 'wrapper.pb-project',
02721             'path':              other_path,
02722             'sourceTree':        'SOURCE_ROOT',
02723           })
02724       self.ProjectsGroup().AppendChild(project_ref)
02725 
02726       ref_dict = {'ProductGroup': product_group, 'ProjectRef': project_ref}
02727       self._other_pbxprojects[other_pbxproject] = ref_dict
02728       self.AppendProperty('projectReferences', ref_dict)
02729 
02730       # Xcode seems to sort this list case-insensitively
02731       self._properties['projectReferences'] = \
02732           sorted(self._properties['projectReferences'], cmp=lambda x,y:
02733                  cmp(x['ProjectRef'].Name().lower(),
02734                      y['ProjectRef'].Name().lower()))
02735     else:
02736       # The link already exists.  Pull out the relevnt data.
02737       project_ref_dict = self._other_pbxprojects[other_pbxproject]
02738       product_group = project_ref_dict['ProductGroup']
02739       project_ref = project_ref_dict['ProjectRef']
02740 
02741     self._SetUpProductReferences(other_pbxproject, product_group, project_ref)
02742 
02743     inherit_unique_symroot = self._AllSymrootsUnique(other_pbxproject, False)
02744     targets = other_pbxproject.GetProperty('targets')
02745     if all(self._AllSymrootsUnique(t, inherit_unique_symroot) for t in targets):
02746       dir_path = project_ref._properties['path']
02747       product_group._hashables.extend(dir_path)
02748 
02749     return [product_group, project_ref]
02750 
02751   def _AllSymrootsUnique(self, target, inherit_unique_symroot):
02752     # Returns True if all configurations have a unique 'SYMROOT' attribute.
02753     # The value of inherit_unique_symroot decides, if a configuration is assumed
02754     # to inherit a unique 'SYMROOT' attribute from its parent, if it doesn't
02755     # define an explicit value for 'SYMROOT'.
02756     symroots = self._DefinedSymroots(target)
02757     for s in self._DefinedSymroots(target):
02758       if (s is not None and not self._IsUniqueSymrootForTarget(s) or
02759           s is None and not inherit_unique_symroot):
02760         return False
02761     return True if symroots else inherit_unique_symroot
02762 
02763   def _DefinedSymroots(self, target):
02764     # Returns all values for the 'SYMROOT' attribute defined in all
02765     # configurations for this target. If any configuration doesn't define the
02766     # 'SYMROOT' attribute, None is added to the returned set. If all
02767     # configurations don't define the 'SYMROOT' attribute, an empty set is
02768     # returned.
02769     config_list = target.GetProperty('buildConfigurationList')
02770     symroots = set()
02771     for config in config_list.GetProperty('buildConfigurations'):
02772       setting = config.GetProperty('buildSettings')
02773       if 'SYMROOT' in setting:
02774         symroots.add(setting['SYMROOT'])
02775       else:
02776         symroots.add(None)
02777     if len(symroots) == 1 and None in symroots:
02778       return set()
02779     return symroots
02780 
02781   def _IsUniqueSymrootForTarget(self, symroot):
02782     # This method returns True if all configurations in target contain a
02783     # 'SYMROOT' attribute that is unique for the given target. A value is
02784     # unique, if the Xcode macro '$SRCROOT' appears in it in any form.
02785     uniquifier = ['$SRCROOT', '$(SRCROOT)']
02786     if any(x in symroot for x in uniquifier):
02787       return True
02788     return False
02789 
02790   def _SetUpProductReferences(self, other_pbxproject, product_group,
02791                               project_ref):
02792     # TODO(mark): This only adds references to products in other_pbxproject
02793     # when they don't exist in this pbxproject.  Perhaps it should also
02794     # remove references from this pbxproject that are no longer present in
02795     # other_pbxproject.  Perhaps it should update various properties if they
02796     # change.
02797     for target in other_pbxproject._properties['targets']:
02798       if not isinstance(target, PBXNativeTarget):
02799         continue
02800 
02801       other_fileref = target._properties['productReference']
02802       if product_group.GetChildByRemoteObject(other_fileref) is None:
02803         # Xcode sets remoteInfo to the name of the target and not the name
02804         # of its product, despite this proxy being a reference to the product.
02805         container_item = PBXContainerItemProxy({
02806               'containerPortal':      project_ref,
02807               'proxyType':            2,
02808               'remoteGlobalIDString': other_fileref,
02809               'remoteInfo':           target.Name()
02810             })
02811         # TODO(mark): Does sourceTree get copied straight over from the other
02812         # project?  Can the other project ever have lastKnownFileType here
02813         # instead of explicitFileType?  (Use it if so?)  Can path ever be
02814         # unset?  (I don't think so.)  Can other_fileref have name set, and
02815         # does it impact the PBXReferenceProxy if so?  These are the questions
02816         # that perhaps will be answered one day.
02817         reference_proxy = PBXReferenceProxy({
02818               'fileType':   other_fileref._properties['explicitFileType'],
02819               'path':       other_fileref._properties['path'],
02820               'sourceTree': other_fileref._properties['sourceTree'],
02821               'remoteRef':  container_item,
02822             })
02823 
02824         product_group.AppendChild(reference_proxy)
02825 
02826   def SortRemoteProductReferences(self):
02827     # For each remote project file, sort the associated ProductGroup in the
02828     # same order that the targets are sorted in the remote project file.  This
02829     # is the sort order used by Xcode.
02830 
02831     def CompareProducts(x, y, remote_products):
02832       # x and y are PBXReferenceProxy objects.  Go through their associated
02833       # PBXContainerItem to get the remote PBXFileReference, which will be
02834       # present in the remote_products list.
02835       x_remote = x._properties['remoteRef']._properties['remoteGlobalIDString']
02836       y_remote = y._properties['remoteRef']._properties['remoteGlobalIDString']
02837       x_index = remote_products.index(x_remote)
02838       y_index = remote_products.index(y_remote)
02839 
02840       # Use the order of each remote PBXFileReference in remote_products to
02841       # determine the sort order.
02842       return cmp(x_index, y_index)
02843 
02844     for other_pbxproject, ref_dict in self._other_pbxprojects.iteritems():
02845       # Build up a list of products in the remote project file, ordered the
02846       # same as the targets that produce them.
02847       remote_products = []
02848       for target in other_pbxproject._properties['targets']:
02849         if not isinstance(target, PBXNativeTarget):
02850           continue
02851         remote_products.append(target._properties['productReference'])
02852 
02853       # Sort the PBXReferenceProxy children according to the list of remote
02854       # products.
02855       product_group = ref_dict['ProductGroup']
02856       product_group._properties['children'] = sorted(
02857           product_group._properties['children'],
02858           cmp=lambda x, y, rp=remote_products: CompareProducts(x, y, rp))
02859 
02860 
02861 class XCProjectFile(XCObject):
02862   _schema = XCObject._schema.copy()
02863   _schema.update({
02864     'archiveVersion': [0, int,        0, 1, 1],
02865     'classes':        [0, dict,       0, 1, {}],
02866     'objectVersion':  [0, int,        0, 1, 46],
02867     'rootObject':     [0, PBXProject, 1, 1],
02868   })
02869 
02870   def ComputeIDs(self, recursive=True, overwrite=True, hash=None):
02871     # Although XCProjectFile is implemented here as an XCObject, it's not a
02872     # proper object in the Xcode sense, and it certainly doesn't have its own
02873     # ID.  Pass through an attempt to update IDs to the real root object.
02874     if recursive:
02875       self._properties['rootObject'].ComputeIDs(recursive, overwrite, hash)
02876 
02877   def Print(self, file=sys.stdout):
02878     self.VerifyHasRequiredProperties()
02879 
02880     # Add the special "objects" property, which will be caught and handled
02881     # separately during printing.  This structure allows a fairly standard
02882     # loop do the normal printing.
02883     self._properties['objects'] = {}
02884     self._XCPrint(file, 0, '// !$*UTF8*$!\n')
02885     if self._should_print_single_line:
02886       self._XCPrint(file, 0, '{ ')
02887     else:
02888       self._XCPrint(file, 0, '{\n')
02889     for property, value in sorted(self._properties.iteritems(),
02890                                   cmp=lambda x, y: cmp(x, y)):
02891       if property == 'objects':
02892         self._PrintObjects(file)
02893       else:
02894         self._XCKVPrint(file, 1, property, value)
02895     self._XCPrint(file, 0, '}\n')
02896     del self._properties['objects']
02897 
02898   def _PrintObjects(self, file):
02899     if self._should_print_single_line:
02900       self._XCPrint(file, 0, 'objects = {')
02901     else:
02902       self._XCPrint(file, 1, 'objects = {\n')
02903 
02904     objects_by_class = {}
02905     for object in self.Descendants():
02906       if object == self:
02907         continue
02908       class_name = object.__class__.__name__
02909       if not class_name in objects_by_class:
02910         objects_by_class[class_name] = []
02911       objects_by_class[class_name].append(object)
02912 
02913     for class_name in sorted(objects_by_class):
02914       self._XCPrint(file, 0, '\n')
02915       self._XCPrint(file, 0, '/* Begin ' + class_name + ' section */\n')
02916       for object in sorted(objects_by_class[class_name],
02917                            cmp=lambda x, y: cmp(x.id, y.id)):
02918         object.Print(file)
02919       self._XCPrint(file, 0, '/* End ' + class_name + ' section */\n')
02920 
02921     if self._should_print_single_line:
02922       self._XCPrint(file, 0, '}; ')
02923     else:
02924       self._XCPrint(file, 1, '};\n')
